children.definition: sail back, Hdt. 1.165, 3.45, And. 2.13, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.102M., etc.

definition: κατάπλεως, ων, gen. ω, Att. for κατάπλεος.

children.definition: panic fear, Poll. 3.137.
LXX Si. 21.4.
Dam. Isid. 284.
one must not be terrified, Din. 1.108.

striking, astonishing, εὐπρόσωπος καὶ κ. Macho ap. Ath. 13.578c; εὐπρέπεια κ. Phld. Hom. p.58O.; terrible, προσβολαί Plb. 3.13.6; πρόσοψις, διήγησις, κραυγή, Id. 3.114.4, 4.28.6, 11.16.2; τὰ εἰς πόλεμον κ. D.S. 2.16; but expressly opp. φοβερός in Muson. Fr. 33p.122H. (nisi leg. καταλλακτικός). Adv. -κῶς Plb. 3.41.3, D.S. 3.35, etc.
astonishing, f.l. for foreg., D.S. 31.8.

stricken, struck, ὑπὸ τῶν γυναικῶν Theopomp.Com. 59: usu. metaph., stricken with amazement, astounded, ὑπὸ τῶν τούτου ἁμαρτημάτων Lys. 6.50; ἄτολμος καὶ κ. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7b; κ. καὶ περιδεής ib. Praec. 814f; μὴ ὦσιν οἱ ἵπποι καταπλῆγες Ael. NA 16.25.
shy, bashful, opp. ἀναίσχυντος, Arist. EN 1108a34, EE 1233b28, Jul. Or. 7.233b.
nervous, apprehensive of, πολλῶν Plu. Fab. 14 codd.
fixed, ὀφθαλμός (in paralysis) Hp. Epid. 5.50.
amazement, consternation, Th. 7.42, 8.66, BGU 1209.16 (i B. C.), etc.; κ. ὀμμάτων fixation, Hp. Epid. 7.56.
extreme shyness, Arist. MM 1193a1.

strike down, τινὸς εἰς τὴν κατακλεῖδα [ ξίφος] PMag.Par. 1.300: usu. metaph., strike with amazement, astound, terrify, κατέπλησσεν ἐπὶ τὸ φοβεῖσθαι Th. 2.65; ὁ φόβος κ. τὰς ψυχάς X. Cyr. 3.1.25; καταπλήξειν ᾤετο τὸν δῆμον D. l.c.; κ. τοὺς ἀκροατάς, of orators, Arist. Rh. 1408a25; -πλῆξαί τινα τῇ προδοσίῃ tax him with his treachery, Hdt. 8.128 (v.l. -πλέξαι); browbeat, bully, POxy. 237 viii 10 (ii A. D.):— Med., -πλήξασθαι τοὺς ὑπεναντίους Plb. 3.89.1, cf. D.S. 11.77, Jul. Or. 6.191a, etc.:— Pass., to be panic-stricken, astounded, most freq. in aor.2 and pf. ( pres., Eup. 159.10), κατεπλήγη φίλον ἦτορ Il. 3.31; -πλαγῆναι τῷ πολέμῳ Th. 1.81; τῷ πλήθει Id. 4.10; μὴ -πέπληχθε ἄγαν Id. 7.77: c. acc., πάνυ τοῦτʼ ἐπαινῶ καὶ -πλήττομαι Eup. l.c.; τὴν ἀπειρίαν τὴν αὑτοῦ -πεπλῆχθαι Isoc. Ep. 4.11; μηδὲν -πλαγέντες τὸν Φίλιππον Decr. ap. D. 18.185; -πεπλῆχθαι τὸν βίον Id. 37.43 codd.; -πεπληγμένοι τὸν στόλον Plb. 1.20.6; to be amazed at, τὴν ἀπαθίαν τινῶν Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.7: later intr. in pf. -πέπληγα, plpf. -πεπλήγη App. Mith. 19, Paus. 10.22.2, Luc. DMeretr. 13.2: esp. in part., -πεπληγότες τὸ τῶν Ῥωμαίων τάχος D.H. 6.25, etc.; τὸ περιδεὲς καὶ -πεπληγός abject terror, Plu. Comp.Pel.Marc. 1.
to be tripped up, ἡμῶν ἴσως σὺ καταπλῐγήσει ( fut. 2) τῷ χορῷ will be tripped up, beaten by our chorus, dub. in Ar. Fr. 198.3, cf. Hsch. s.v. καταπλιγήσει.
entwining, interlacing, τοῦ νεύρου καὶ τοῦ δέρματος Pl. Ti. 76d; complication, τῶν πραγμάτων Artem. 2.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: descending progression, opp. ἀναπλοκή, Ptol. Harm. 2.12.
sailing down, bearing down, Th. 4.10; sailing to land, putting ashore, ib. 26; ὁ Σικελικὸς κ. the arrival of the corn-fleet from Sicily, D. 56.9.
sailing down stream, esp. down the Nile, ὁ κατʼ ἐνιαυτὸν εἰς Ἀλεξάνδρειαν κ. OGI 90.17 ( Rosetta, ii B. C.), cf. PTeb. 27.103 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: sailing back, return, ὁ οἴκαδε κ. X. HG 1.4.11; παρῆν τις ἐκ κ. one who had just returned, Plb. 15.23.3.
enrich greatly, τινα Hdt. 6.132, X. Oec. 4.7; τινὰ εὐεργεσίαις Ph. 2.588.
conquer by money, D.S. 5.38.
drench with foul abuse, Com.Adesp. 715.
drench, ὕδατι τὴν κεφαλήν X. Eq. 5.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: wash out, remove by washing, [ ἁλμυρόν τι] Arist. Mete. 357b5:— Pass., καταπλῠθείσης τῆς ἅλμης Thphr. CP 3.24.3: metaph., καταπέπλῠται τὸ πρᾶγμα the affair is washed out, has become worthless, Aeschin. 3.178, cf. Poll. 7.38.
bathing in water, τῶν σκελῶν X. Eq. 5.9.

definition: κατάπλωσις, εως, ἡ, Ion. for κατάπλους,

children.definition: home-coming by sea, Herod. 1.68:

blow or breathe upon or over, τί τινος, χώρας (Reisk. for χώραν) καταπνεῦσαι ἡδυπνόους αὔρας E. Med. 839 (lyr.); Ἔρως ἵμερον κ. ἡμῶν κατὰ τῶν κόλπων Ar. Lys. 552: with gen. understood, Arist. HA 541a29, 594b27: also c. acc., κ. τόπον εὐωδίᾳ fill the place with fragrance, Hld. 3.2: c. acc. cogn., ἡδὺ κ. h.Cer. 238:— Pass., σπινθὴρ -πνευσθείς Ph. 1.455; -πνευσθέντες ὑπὸ ἀνέμων ψυχρῶν blown upon by . . , Gal. 12.599; στρατόπεδον οὐ -πνεόμενον ἐκ τῆς θαλάσσης App. Pun. 99: abs., ὅταν Βορρᾶς -πνεύσῃ Cratin. 207.

data.quote: Ἔρως ἵμερον κ. ἡμῶν κατὰ τῶν κόλπων

children.definition: inspire, θεόθεν καταπνείει πειθὼ . . ξύμφυτος αἰών A. Ag. 105 (s. v.l., lyr.); θεοῦ ὁμόνοιαν, ὀργὴν δικαίαν -πνέοντος, Ael. NA 12.2, 7: c. acc. pers., θεὸς καταπνεῖ σε E. Rh. 387:— Pass., -πνευσθείς Ph. 1.411.
blow upon, c. dat., τοῖς πρὸς ἄρκτον οἰκοῦσι . . κ. ὁ νότος Arist. Pr. 945a36: metaph., μή σοι νέμεσις θεόθεν καταπνεύσῃ Pl. Com. 173.14.

data.quote: τοῖς πρὸς ἄρκτον οἰκοῦσι . . κ. ὁ νότος

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be blown up, φλόξ Plu. Tranq. 2.474d.

choke, smother, γόγγρον ἐν ἅλμῃ Sotad.Com. 1.21; ὁ ὕπνος κ. τὸ θερμόν Arist. Fr. 233; ταῦτα κ. τὰ δένδρα Thphr. CP 2.18.3; τὴν αὔξησιν Plu. Praec. 2.806c; πνεῦμα Nic. Al. 286; λύγγας Arist. Pr. 962a7:— Pass., to be choked up, of the secretions, ib. 967a6; of a fire, opp. ἐγκρύπτω 2, Id. Juv. 470a16; καταπεπνιγμένοι τόποι choked up, close, opp. εὐπνούστεροι, Id. Pr. 869a35; φωναὶ καταπεπν. stifled utterances, Id. Aud. 800a15, cf. Poll. 4.114.
κ. τὰς φύσας close the bellows, Arist. Resp. 474a15.
choking, smothering, opp. εὔπνοια, Arist. Pr. 966b36, cf. Thphr. HP 5.9.4, Sud. 9.
blowing, ἀνέμων Pi. P. 5.121 codd.
obstruct, hamper, Phld. Lib. p.15O.
gullet, pharyngeal region, Paul.Aeg. 6.32, Hippiatr. 16.
depress, Hp. Mochl. 2 (v.l. κακοποιεῖ).

deck with various colours or in divers modes, mottle, τὸ σῶμα Pl. Ti. 85a; θάλαμος, ὃν αἱ χάριτες κατεποίκιλαν Men.Rh. p.407S.; διττὰ ὑφάσματα Ph. 2.226:— Pass., ὑπὸ τῶν γραφέων τὰ ἱερὰ ἡμῖν καταπεποίκιλται Pl. Euthphr. 6c; ὀροφὴ ἀστέρας καταπεποικιλμένη D.S. 1.47.

data.quote: ὑπὸ τῶν γραφέων τὰ ἱερὰ ἡμῖν καταπεποίκιλται

children.definition: κ. τὸν λόγον Isoc. 13.16, Phld. Rh. 1.167S.; also κ. τὰ γεγενημένα, of historians, Agath. Praef. p.136D.

war down, i.e. exhaust by war, reduce, τὴν Πελοπόννησον Th. 2.7, cf. 4.1, And. 3.15, X. HG 7.1.10: pres., attempt to subdue, ἐγκλήμασι Th. 4.86:— Pass., ἐλπίζοντες αὐτὴν [ τὴν πόλιν] καταπεπολεμῆσθαι Id. 6.16, cf. Pl. Mx. 243c, 243d.

children.label: II
children.definition: make war against, τινα Phld. Piet. 54: abs., carry on warfare, τοῖς ὅλοις Plu. Caes. 26.
subduing, condemned by Poll. 9.142.
revolve, ὁ ἰσημερινὸς τῷ βορείῳ κύκλῳ -εύοντι βραδυτέρω<ς> . . ὁμοχρόνως κινεῖται Sch. Arat. 147; of the constellation Ἄρκτος, move downwards in an orbit, opp. ἀναπολεύω, PMag.Par. 1.702.
white-haired, Gloss.
subdue or reduce by policy, τινα D. 19.315, Plu. Pomp. 51, Galb. 20, etc.
scoff at, τινος Luc. Am. 37.
delivery, rendering of goods or returns, POxy. 1415.7, BGU 362viii 15 (both iii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: sending back, Afric. ap. Eus. DE 8.2.
one who conveys or delivers, c. gen., POxy. 1415.5 (iii A. D.), etc.

subdue, τῇ ἐνδείᾳ τῆς τροφῆς τὴν ἀλκὴν τοῦ θηρίου D.S. 3.37, cf. Heraclit. Incred. 11: in fut. Med., τὰς ὀλίγας ναῦς ταῖς πολλαπλασίαις D.S. 11.15; worst in a lawsuit, POxy. 1101.9 (iv A. D.):— Pass., to be subdued, reduced, worn out, δῆμος -πεπονημένος Aeschin. 2.36, cf. Plb. 29.27.11, D.S. 11.6; πάντα ταῖς ἐνδελεχείαις -πονεῖται πράγματα Men. 744; to be exhausted, τῷ θάλπει Gal. 10.715.

data.quote: τῇ ἐνδείᾳ τῆς τροφῆς τὴν ἀλκὴν τοῦ θηρίου

children.definition: handle roughly, crush, damage, τὰ -πονούμενα καὶ συμπατούμενα Thphr. HP 8.7.5; maltreat, oppress, esp. in Pass., ὑπὸ τῶν τυράννων, ὑπὸ τῶν τελωνῶν, Arist. Fr. 575, BGU 1188.17 (Aug.), cf. Act.Ap. 7.24, Diog.Oen. 1.
digest food, Sor. 2.32 ( Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: pf. part. -πεπονηκώς ruinous, Procop. Aed. 1.4, 8.
affliction, Sm. Ex. 3.7.
tired, wearied, ἀθλητής Plu. Sull. 29; worn out, exhausted, of cattle, PLond. 3.1170v462 (iii A. D.); ὑπʼ ἀλλήλων Plu. Alc. 25.

children.label: II
children.definition: laboured, of poetry or works of art, Id. Tim. 36; wearisome, λατρεία LXX 3 Ma. 4.14; κ. βάρος Phld. D. 3.13.

throw into the sea, plunge or drown therein, τινα Lys. 14.27, D. 23.169, Plu. Pyth. 2.403c, etc.: metaph., Axiop. 6 ( Pass.); κ. τὰς βουλάς Lib. Or. 49.10:— Pass., v.l. in Plb. 2.60.8; καταποντισθεὶς ὑπὸ τῆς θαλάσσης D.S. 18.20; ἐν τῷ πελάγει Ev.Matt. 18.6; εἰς τὸ πέλαγος Plu. Tim. 13; sink, Ev.Matt. 14.30; of a ship, PPetr. 2p.135 (iii B. C.).
drowning, Isoc. 12.122 (pl.), LXX Ps. 51(52).4(6); ὁ κ. τῶν χρημάτων App. Mac. 16.
one who throws into the sea, of pirates, λῃσταὶ καὶ κ. Isoc. 12.226, D. 23.166,167, cf. Jul. Or. 6.201b: metaph., καταποντισταὶ τῆς Ἑλλάδος Paus. 8.52.3, cf. Lib. Or. 63.17.
Hdt. 1.165, 4.154, Xenarch. 2.5, etc.; κ. ἐς τὴν θάλασσαν Hdt. 3.30; εἰς ποταμόν Polem.Hist. 54; τὴν οὐσίαν Philostr. VA 1.13:— Pass., Antipho 5.28, Pl. Grg. 511e, Ph. 1.264, 394, Plu. Cat.Mi. 11.
come back from banishment, Plb. 4.17.8, OGI 90.19 ( Rosetta, ii B. C.).
return home, LXX 2 Ma. 11.30, 3 Ma. 4.11.
κ. εἰς τάξιν, = Lat. regredi in ordinem, IG 7.2225.42 ( Thisbe).
fail in treating:—hence in Pass., κατηπορήθη ὀστέα ἐμπεσεῖν there was a failure in reducing the fracture, Hp. Fract. 33; οἷσι ἂν ὦμος κ. ἐμβληθῆναι Id. Art. 12, cf. 61.
ravage utterly, Gloss.
an East wind, blowing down the Straits of Messina, Arist. Vent. 973a25.
remeo, Gloss.
prostitution, θυγατέρων παρθένων Plu. Tim. 13 (pl.).
prostitute, τὰ θήλεα τέκνα Hdt. 1.94, 196:— Pass., Str. 11.14.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: violate, treat as prostitutes, Plu. Praec. 2.821d, Ael. VH 9.8:— Pass., prob. in POxy. 1241 iii 11.

children.label: III
children.definition: squander on courtesans, D.C. 45.28.
all-purple, Lyd. Mag. 2.13.
ludi Florales, Gloss.
gulping down, swallowing, Pl. Ti. 80a, Arist. PA 690b28, Gal. 10.506; τῆς τροφῆς Aret. CA 1.4; τοῦ Κρόνου τῶν παίδων Sallust. 4 (pl.); [ τέχνης] Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.257.

children.label: II
children.definition: gullet, Muson. Fr. 18A p.97 H., Epict. Gnom. 22, Dsc. 3.80, Sor. 1.86, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.93, Aret. SD 1.7.
send down (to Alexandria), UPZ 110.137 (ii B. C.).
fly down, v.l. in Lib. Or. 11.86.
Hsch. s.v. βρόγχος, Suid.

pill, bolus, v.l. for καταπότια in Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 70, Mul. 2.133, cj. for κατὰ ποτόν in Thphr. HP 9.20.2: in pl., things swallowed, Aret. CA 2.2:— Dim. κατα-πότιον, little pill, Hp. ll. cc., Thphr. HP 9.8.3, Ruf. ap. Orib. 7.26.125, Archig.ib. 8.2.30, POxy. 2144.4 (iii A. D.), etc.
pronounce dogmatically, Diog.Oen. 8.
receipt, Arch.Pap. 3.418 (vi A. D.).

definition: καταπραγματεύω, Act. and Med., c. gen., sine expl., Suid.

children.definition: ravage, Suid. s.v. καταδῃοῦν.
fitted for accomplishing, τῶν νοηθέντων Muson. Fr. 8p.39H.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. -κόν, τό, spell for achieving success, PMag.Par. 1.2373.
Att. for καταπρηνής, πρόσχωσις J. AJ 4.8.5, cf. Hsch.
execution, τῶν βεβουλευμένων J. AJ 19.1.4.
accomplish, execute, τινί τι X. An. 7.7.46; τιτῶν ἐπειγόντων Plu. Per. 5; κ. ὥστε τι γίγνεσθαι X. HG 7.4.11.

children.label: b
children.definition: construct, build, ἡρῷον IG 12(7).478.2 ( Amorgos).

achieve, gain, ἀρχήν X. Cyr. 7.5.76:— Med., achieve for oneself, dub. in Id. An. 7.7.27, cf. Zos. 1.44; ὅπως καταπράξεται τὸν γάμον Men. 242; ἰδίαν ἀσφάλειαν D.H. 6.68:— Pass., τὰ καταπεπραγμένα X. Cyr. 7.5.35; τὴν ἡγεμονίαν -πραχθῆναι Id. Vect. 5.5.
tax on sales, Inscr.Magn. 116.42.
placation, Gloss.

definition: καταπραΰνω, fut. -πραῠνῶ Hsch.: Ep. and Ion. κατα-πρηΰνω:—

children.definition: soften, opp. τραχύνω, Pl. Ti. 67a: usu. metaph., soften down, appease, Pl. Euthd. 288b, A.R. 1.265, Q.S. 14.328; κ. τοὺς ἀκροατάς, of an orator, Isoc. 4.13, cf. Arist. Rh. 1380b30; κ. τὴν ταραχήν Plb. 5.52.14; κ. τινὰ τῆς ὀργῆς Plu. Them. 31:— Pass., to be pacified, of animals, Phld. Mus. p.20 K.; to be allayed, of emotions, Id. Rh. 1.370S.
with many branches, Hsch.
undertake an embassy against, τινος Str. 17.1.11: abs., Plb. 22.11.8.

down-turned, opp. ὕπτιος, in Hom. always of the hand as used in striking or grasping, πλῆξεν . . χειρὶ καταπρηνεῖ with the flat of his hand, Il. 16.792, cf. Od. 13.164; πεπλήγετο μηρὼ χερσὶ καταπρηνέσσι Il. 15.114; χείρεσσι κ. λαβοῦσα Od. 19.467; ἐς τὸ κ. ῥέποντα Hp. Fract. 40. ( Ion. for καταπρανής, q. v.)
throw headlong down, ἁλιῆας . . κατεπρήνιξεν ἐπάκτρου εἰς ἅλα Nic. Th. 824, cf. Nonn. D. 4.395.
= foreg., τινὰ πόντῳ καταπρηνώσασθαι AP 7.652 ( Leon.).
sawn, ἐλέφας prob. in Hermipp. 63.15.
saw up, κορμοὺς ξύλων Hdt. 7.36; saw asunder, LXX Su. 59.
cut or bite into pieces, κύμινον Theoc. 10.55; γλῶσσαν κυνόδοντι Nic. Al. 283.
prostrate, prob. f.l. for προκαταβάλλω, Gal. 19.622.
betray utterly, leave in the lurch, Hdt. 7.157, 8.94, Ar. V. 1044, Th. 1.86, 7.48, etc.; τὰς Ἀφίδνας τινί Hdt. 9.73; τὰ πράγματα Lys. 20.6:— Pass., Hdt. 9.7.αʹ, Th. 3.111.

definition: καταπροθυμέομαι, strengthd. for προθυμέομαι, c. acc., Suid.

children.definition: throw away, abandon, τοὺς καιρούς Plb. 1.77.3, etc.; τοὺς ἰδίους βίους Id. 3.81.4, cf. PRev.Laws 27.11 (iii B. C.), PTeb. 27.61 (ii B. C.); τὸ ζῆν Phld. Mort. 5; πολλὰ τῶν κοινῶν τοῖς κλέπτουσιν Plu. Arist. 4; ἀλλήλω Procop. Arc. 1 ( ἀλλήλων codd.): aor. καταπροηκάμην Poll. 8.143.

definition: καταπροΐξομαι, Att. καταπροίξομαι, in early writers only fut., later also aor. 1 (v. infr.): used with neg., and usu. c. part., οὐ γὰρ δὴ ἐμέ γε ὧδε λωβησάμενος καταπροΐξεται he

children.definition: shall not escape unpunished for thus insulting me, Hdt. 3.156; οὐ καταπροΐξονται ἀποστάντες Id. 5.105, cf. 7.17; οὔτοι καταπροίξει τάλαντα πολλὰ κλέψας Ar. Eq. 435; οὔτοι καταπροίξει τοῦτο δρῶν you shall not escape unpunished for doing this, Id. V. 1366; οὔτοι . . καταπροίξει λέγουσα ταυτί Id. Th. 566: abs., ἐκείνους οὐ καταπροΐξεσθαι ἔφη should not get off scot-free, Hdt. 3.36: without a neg., Them. Or. 2.25b: in aor. 1, οὐ μὴν ἐκεῖνός γε παντελῶς κατεπροίξατο Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10c ( -πράξ- codd.), cf. Hsch.

data.quote: οὐ μὴν ἐκεῖνός γε παντελῶς κατεπροίξατο

children.definition: ἐμεῦ δʼ ἐκεῖνος οὐ καταπροΐξεται he shall not escape me unpunished, Archil. 92; οὔτοι ἐμοῦ . . καταπροίξει Ar. Nu. 1240; οὔτοι . . καταπροίξει Μυρτίας Id. V. 1396.

οὐ καταπροίξῃ αὐτὸς μεθύων νηφούσης γυναικός Hdn. 1.17.5.-- Ion. word, used in colloquial Att. of Com. (Glossed προῖκα ἐκφύγοι in Suid., δωρεὰν καταγνώσεται in EM 495.34, and connected by both with προΐσσομαι, προΐκτης; but perh. rather from κατα-προ-ἱκνέομαι.)

data.quote: οὐ καταπροίξῃ αὐτὸς μεθύων νηφούσης γυναικός

children.definition: forsake utterly, A.R. 3.1164.
carry off as booty, LXX Nu. 21.1, Jd. 2.14.
IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 45, 165.22 ( Delos, iii B. C.); κατάπροσθε ib. 163.51.
hold out as a pretence, Gal. 5.92.
get the better of, τινος D.S. 17.33; κ. τὸν καιρόν seize a favourable opportunity, Men.Prot. p.102 D.:— Pass., to be beaten, yield, τοῖς ἐπιβατικοῖς, ταῖς εὐχειρίαις, Plb. 1.47.9, 16.19.1.
pour down over, δάκρυα παρειῶν A.R. 3.1118.
Ar. Ec. 364.
winged, A. Pr. 798, E. Or. 176 (lyr.).
furnish with wings, ἱππείᾳ τριχί E. Melanipp.Sap.Prol. 15, cf. Apollod. 1.6.3 ( Pass.).

definition: καταπτήσσω, fut. -πτήξω (v. infr.): 3 dual Ep. aor. 2 καταπτήτην Il. 8.136: poet. aor. part. καταπτᾰκών A. Eu. 252 (cf. καταπλακών): pf. κατέπτηκα LXX Jo. 2.24 (v.l. -έπτηχε), Did. in D. 11.25, Them. Or. 24.309b, or κατέπτηχα D. 4.8, Plu. Per. 25, Gal. 5.510; Ep. part. καταπεπτηώς (v. infr.):—

children.definition: crouch, cower, esp. from fear, καταπτήτην ὑπʼ ὄχεσφι Il. 8.136; καταπτήξας ὑπὸ θάμνῳ 22.191; κατὰ δʼ ἔπτηξαν ποτὶ γαίῃ Od. 8.190; λιμῷ καταπεπτηυῖα Hes. Sc. 265: also in Prose, κατέπτηχε μέντοι ταῦτα πάντα νῦν D. l.c., cf. D.H. 7.50; ταπεινοὶ -πτήξετε πρὸς τὸ μέλλον Plu. Aem. 27; διὰ τὸ μέγεθος Id. Sull. 7.
cower beneath, ἐξουσίαν D.H. 11.18; τὸ θεοῦ κράτος Ph. 1.677, cf. 322, 2.600; of a breach in a wall, ἀπειλουμένην ὅσον οὔπω κατεπτηχέναι τὴν ἐπίκλυσιν Hld. 9.5.

data.quote: ἀπειλουμένην ὅσον οὔπω κατεπτηχέναι τὴν ἐπίκλυσιν

children.definition: grind to powder, Plu. Virt.mor. 2.449e, Nic.Dam. 118J.
frighten, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 29.
to be terrified, Aq. Ge. 41.8.
putacilla, Gloss.

definition: κατάπτυστος, ον, also η, ον Anacr. 152;

children.definition: to be spat upon, abominable, Anacr. l.c., A. Ch. 632 (lyr.), Eu. 68; ὦ κ. κάρα E. Tr. 1024: also in Com. and Prose, Anaxil. 22.6, D. 18.33, etc.
with ample folds, ἐμπερόναμα Theoc. 15.34.

spit upon or at, esp. as a mark of abhorrence or contempt, c. gen., τίς οὐχὶ κατέπτυσεν ἂν σοῦ; D. 18.200, cf. Aeschin. 3.73, Luc. Cat. 12, etc.; κ. δωροδοκίας Aeschin. 2.23; πλούτου Luc. Icar. 30: abs., Ar. Ra. 1179. [On the quantity, v. πτύω.]
downfall, LXX Ps. 143(144).14.
τὸ κ. τοῦ ὄντος μὴ ὄν the Not-Being which forms the lower limit of Being, Porph. Sent. 26.

children.label: II
children.definition: debility, collapse, Alex.Trall. 9.2.
fall, Hp. Art. 42; ἐξ ὀχήματος Gal. 7.560; λίθου Simp. in Ph. 261.17.
collapse, ἡ συγκοπή ἐστι κ. δυνάμεως Gal. 10.837; of epileptic seizures, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.64, cf. Vett.Val. 38.13 (pl.): hence of a spell which induces a trance, PMag.Par. 1.850.
downfall, calamity, LXX 3 Ma. 2.14.
liable to fits, Vett.Val. 112.34.
reduce to beggary, beggar, Plu. Cat.Mi. 25:— Pass., to be or become beggared, Id. Cic. 10; τύχαι κατεπτωχευμέναι beggared fortunes, D.H. 9.51.
to be or act like a καταπύγων, Phot.
conquer in boxing, Sch. AP 11.80 ( Lucill.).
Hsch., Phot., prob. in Gerhard Phoinix p.7 (cf. p.153): Comp. -ότερος Sophr. 63: Sup. -ότατος Epigr.Gr. 1131.
male passive homosexuality, Cratin. 53, Ar. Nu. 1023 (anap.), Fr. 130, Luc. Gall. 32.

definition: καταπύγων, ονος, ὁ, ἡ, neut. κατάπυγον Ar. V. 687: ( πυγή):—

children.definition: male passive homosexual, sts. loosely as a term of abuse [Supp.], Id. Ach. 79, al., Luc. Tim. 22, Alciphr. 3.45, etc.; ὦ κατάπυγον Ar. Th. 200.--The oblique cases are sts. wrongly written -πύγωνος, cf. Hdn. Gr. 2.725: irreg. Comp. -πυγωνέστερος (metri gr.) Ar. Lys. 776.

children.label: II
children.definition: Att., the middle finger (used in an obscene gesture), Poll. 2.184.
putrefy, τὴν . . κατέπυσʼ ἱερὸν μένος Ἠελίοιο h.Ap. 371:— Pass. (with pf. -πέπῡθα Hsch. ( -οιθα cod.)), become putrefied, ξύλον . . · τὸ μὲν οὐ καταπύθεται ὄμβρῳ Il. 23.328.

data.quote: ξύλον . . · τὸ μὲν οὐ καταπύθεται ὄμβρῳ

children.definition: cover over, Hsch. s.v. κατερρινωμένον ( Pass.): metaph., μύθοις τὴν ἱστορίαν Eust. 1379.12.
thick, tufted, ἕρπυλλος Theoc. Ep. 1.1.
ἐν κ. στάσει in close formation, Ascl. Tact. 5.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: very costive, κοιλίη Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 56 (24).

children.label: III
children.definition: κ. εἰς σχηματισμόν often using a formation, A.D. Adv. 186.2; ἡ διάλεκτος κ. ἐπὶ τὴν χρῆσιν Id. Synt. 50.18.

data.quote: ἡ διάλεκτος κ. ἐπὶ τὴν χρῆσιν

children.definition: stud thickly, τρήμασι τὸ τεῖχος Plb. 8.5.6; θύρας ἥλοις D.S. 18.71; τοῖς ἀφώνοις τὰς συλλαβάς D.H. Comp. 16; παραδειγμάτων πλήθει τὴν πόλιν Plu. Lyc. 27; τοῖς ὑπερβατοῖς Phld. Rh. 1.160 S.:— Pass., of the sky, καταπεπυκνῶσθαι . . πλήθει ἀστέρων Arist. Mete. 346a29; of a country, ἐλαίαις καταπεπυκνῶσθαι to be thickly planted with . . (v.l. for -πεφυτεῦσθαι), D.S. 3.44: metaph., βίος ἐν θαλίαις -πεπυκνωμένος Porph. Plot. 23.

children.label: II
children.definition: force into a small compass, compress, condense, Ἐπίκουρος οὕτω κατεπύκνου τὴν ἡδονήν Damox. 2.62; τάλαντʼ ἐγώ σοι κατεπύκνωσα τέτταρα spent four talents in a lump, ib. 4; to illustrate this is cited the dogma of Epicur., Sent. 9, εἰ κατεπυκνοῦτο πᾶσα ἡδονὴ κτλ., cf. καταπύκνωσις; ὁ Λυκοῦργος τοὺς πολίτας τῇ σιωπῇ πιέζων συνῆγε καὶ κατεπύκνου Plu. Garr. 2.510f:— Pass., -πεπύκνωται ἡ πραγματεία Porph. Plot. 14; also εἰ μὴ -πυκνοῦταί σοι τὸ ἀπὸ δογμάτων ὀρθῶν ἕκαστα πράσσειν that your habit of acting . . is not consolidated, M.Ant. 5.9.

data.quote: καταπύκνωσις; ὁ Λυκοῦργος τοὺς πολίτας τῇ σιωπῇ πιέζων συνῆγε καὶ κατεπύκνου

children.definition: κ. τὸ διάγραμμα fill up the intervals in a scale (with smaller intervals), Aristox. Harm. p.7 M.:— Pass., Theo Sm. p.91 H., Nicom. Exc. 7.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be condensed, of complex forms of inference (cf. πυκνόω v), Arist. APo. 79a30.

condensation (v. καταπυκνόω II), τοῦ ἡδομένου densification, solidification of pleasure by filling in unoccupied gaps in time and completing the penetration of the organism, Epicur. Fr. 432: pl., Dam. Pr. 354.
close packing of the intervals in a scale, Aristox. Harm. p.7 M., Nicom. Harm. 11.
one must fill up, of intervals in music, Theo Sm. p.91 H.; cf. καταπυκνόω II.2.
conquer in boxing, Sch. A.R. 2.98 ( Pass.), cj. in Pl. Com. 124.
dry, ἕως ἂν . . -ωθῇ [ τὸ ἔριον] PHolm. 20.24 (fort. καπυρωθῇ).
waste with fire, Ar. Th. 243 ( Pass.), Plb. 5.19.8, Palaeph. 52 ( Pass.), Phalar. Ep. 104.
very red, deep red, Dsc. 5.77; f.l. for καπυρός, Id. 2.154.
with a long beard, D.S. 3.63, Str. 16.4.10.
sell, BGU 8 iii 13 (iii A. D.), PThead. 16.18 (iv A.D.).
close up, ὀπήν Hero Aut. 28.5.

curse, κατάρας ποιέεσθαί τινι to lay curses upon one, Hdt. 1.165; ἐποιήσαντο νόμον τε καὶ κατάρην μὴ . . θρέψειν κόμην . . μηδένα ib. 82; ἐκ κατάρης τευ in consequence of . . , Id. 4.30; διδόναι τινὰ κατάρᾳ E. Hec. 945 (lyr.), cf. El. 1324 (pl., anap.), A. Th. 725 (pl., lyr.); opp. εὐχή, Pl. Alc. 2.143b (pl.), cf. SIG 1241 ( Lyttus, iii A.D.), etc.; opp. εὐλογία, Ep.Jac. 3.10; κατάραι γίγνονται κατά τινος Plb. 23.10.7; τὴν κ. ἀναγράψαι, στηλιτεῦσαι, D.S. 1.45, Plu. Isid. 2.354b; cursing, κ. καὶ λοιδορία Phld. Lib. p.11 O.

definition: καταραιρημένος, Ion. pf. part. Pass. of καθαιρέω, q. v.

children.definition: shutters, IG 2(2).463.76; cf. καταρράκτης.
curse, Sch. E. Ph. 1355.

call down curses upon, τῷ δὲ κατᾱρῶνται πάντες βροτοὶ ἄλγεʼ ὀπίσσω Od. 19.330; πολλὰ κατηρᾶτο he called down many curses, Il. 9.454; κεφαλῇ πολλὰ κ. Hdt. 2.39; κ. ὁ κῆρυξ εἴ τις ἐξαπατᾷ λέγων D. 23.97; κ. τὴν Ἶσίν τινι AP 11.115 ( Nicarch.): c. inf., καταρῶνται δʼ ἀπολέσθαι they pray that he may perish, Thgn. 277; κ. μήτε πλοῖα στεγανὰ γενέσθαι Arist. Fr. 554, cf. 148: c. dat., curse, execrate, τῷ ἡλίῳ Hdt. 4.184, cf. Ar. Nu. 871, Ra. 746, D. 19.292 codd., etc.: c. acc., LXX Ge. 12.3, al., Ev.Marc. 11.21, Plu. Cat.Mi. 32 codd., Luc. Asin. 27: abs., Ar. V. 614, D. 18.283:— Pass., aor. κατηράθην [ᾱ] LXX Jb. 3.5: pf. part. κατηραμένος accursed, ib. 4 Ki. 9.34, Ev.Matt. 25.41, Plu. Luc. 18: also pf. κεκατήραμαι with double redupl., LXX Nu. 22.6; part. κεκατηραμένος ib. Si. 3.18, al.

data.quote: τῷ δὲ κατᾱρῶνται πάντες βροτοὶ ἄλγεʼ ὀπίσσω
κ. ὁ κῆρυξ εἴ τις ἐξαπατᾷ λέγων

children.definition: accursed, Suid. s.v. ἀράσιμος.
cursing, LXX Jd. 5.23.

dash down, break in pieces, ὁ παῖς ἐμπεσὼν κατήραξε (sc. τὴν κύλικα) Hippon. 38:— Pass., ἡ θύρη κατήρακται Herod. 2.63: metaph., διασείειν καὶ κ. τὰ βουλεύματα cj. for ταράττειν in Luc. Dem.Enc. 38; esp. of a broken and routed army, τοὺς λοιποὺς κατήραξεν ἐς τὸν Κιθαιρῶνα Hdt. 9.69; κ. εἰς τὴν θάλασσαν ἅπαντας D. 23.165; τὸ στράτευμα κατηράχθη εἰς τὰ τειχίσματα Th. 7.6, cf. D.H. 9.58, Arr. An. 5.17.2: fut. Med. in pass. sense, Plu. Caes. 44.

data.quote: τοὺς λοιποὺς κατήραξεν ἐς τὸν Κιθαιρῶνα
τὸ στράτευμα κατηράχθη εἰς τὰ τειχίσματα

children.label: II
children.definition: κ. αὑτοὺς εἰς τὰς κεφαλὰς αὐτῶν dash down head foremost, Arist. Mir. 836a13: but more freq.

fall down, fall headlong, Clearch. 44; of rain, Arist. Mu. 392b10; of rivers, εἰς τὸ χάσμα κ. D.S. 17.75, cf. Plb. 10.48.7, Str. 14.4.1: c. gen., τοῦ ἀγγείου, of a stream of water, Gal. 10.554. (Freq. written καταρρ-, augm. κατερρ-, in part perh. correctly, if fr. κατα-ρρᾱσσω, cf. ῥάσσω, ἐπιρράσσω.)

definition: κατάρατος [ᾰρ], ον, Ion. κατ-ήρητος Herod. 5.44, but κατάρητος Schwyzer 702.11 ( Erythrae, iv B.C.):—

children.definition: accursed, abominable, E. Med. 112 (anap.): freq. in Com., ὡς σεμνὸς ὁ κ. Ar. Ra. 178, cf. Pax 33; ὦ κατάρατε Id. Lys. 530, etc.: Comp. καταρατότερος D. 18.212: Sup. -ότατος S. OT 1345 (lyr.).
make a rough surface on masonry, dub. in IG 2(2).1665.12 (iv B. C.).
reaching down to the shoes, χλαῖναι S. Fr. 622:—also καθάρβυλος, χλανίς Hsch.
leave unemployed or idle, χέρα E. Ph. 753; κατηργηκέναι τοὺς καιρούς to have missed the opportunities, Plb. Fr. 176; κ. τὴν γῆν make the ground useless, cumber it, Ev.Luc. 13.7.
cause to be idle, hinder in oneʼs work, LXX 2 Es. 4.21, POxy. 38.17 (i A.D.):— Pass., LXX 2 Es. 6.8; to be rendered or lie idle, PFlor. 176.7 (iii A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: make of no effect, Ep.Rom. 3.3, 31, al.:— Pass., to be abolished, cease, ib. 6.6, 1 Ep.Cor. 2.6, etc.; κ. ἀπὸ τοῦ νόμου to be set free from . . , Ep.Rom. 7.2; to be parted, ἀπὸ Χριστοῦ Ep.Gal. 5.4.
making null, abolishing, cj. in Sm. Ps. 45.9, La. 1.7.
one must abolish, cancel, τὰ πάθη Iamb. Protr. 5.
reduction to inactivity, inhibition, τῶν αἰσθήσεων Corp.Herm. 10.5.

definition: κάταργμα, ατος, τό, only pl. κατάργματα,

children.definition: first offerings (cf. κατάρχω II 2), χέρνιβάς τε καὶ κατάργματα E. IT 244, cf. Plu. Thes. 22.
covered with silver, silvered, Callix. 2, Socr. Rhod.1, J. BJ 5.5.3, Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.828e.
cover with silver, silver over, Philoch. 138:— Pass., καταργυρωμένους ( Ion. for κατηργ-) ἔχων τοὺς προμαχεῶνας Hdt. 1.98, cf. D.S. 1.57.

children.label: II
children.definition: buy or bribe with silver, ἄθρησον εἰ κατηργυρωμένος λέγω S. Ant. 1077.
irriguus, Gloss.
water, Θρῄκην ( -ης codd. Ath.) Antiph. 105, cf. D.H. 2.2.

besprinkle, πολυτελείᾳ τῶν ἀλειμμάτων J. AJ 11.6.2 ( Pass.): metaph., besprinkle with praise, Ar. Ach. 658; also, to be swept along, χειμάρρῳ οἷα -αρδόμενα, of the poetry of Aeschylus, AP 7.411 ( Diosc.).
accursed, IG 5(2).3.4 ( Tegea, iv B.C.).
rushing from above, Alc. 135, Sapph. 160 (v.l. κατώρης).
making one shudder, horrible, λυγρά, τά τʼ ἄλλοισίν γε καταριγηλὰ πέλονται [ κατᾱρ-] Od. 14.226.

count or reckon among, μετά τινων E. Tr. 872 ( Pass.); ἔν τισι Pl. Plt. 266a, cf. D.S. 4.85, Plu. Sol. 12; εἰς εὐδαιμονίαν κ. reckon as . . , Ath. 1.9d: c. dupl. acc., Pl. Sph. 266e:— Pass., Arist. Pol. 1329a27; μετά τινων ib. 1293b26; ἔν τισι Act.Ap. 1.17, Phld. Rh. 1.239 S.

recount in detail, τὴν ἀτοπίαν σου Pl. Smp. 215a:— Med., recount, enumerate, Id. Phlb. 27b, Grg. 451e, Isoc. 1.11; τι πρός τινα Aeschin. 3.54: pf. Pass. in med. sense, τὰς τῶν πολλῶν κατηριθμημένοι δόξας having summed up . . , Arist. Top. 101a31:— Pass., Phld. Ir. p.78 W.; τὰ συμβεβηκότα -ηρίθμηται S.E. M. 7.281.
Med., count or reckon so and so, εὐδαιμονέστατον κ. τινά Pl. Phlb. 47b; ἐν ἀδικήματι κ. τὴν πρᾶξιν Plb. 5.67.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: count, reckon, διὰ τί πάντες ἄνθρωποι εἰς τὰ δέκα κ.; Arist. Pr. 910b24.
computation, χρόνων J. Ap. 1.21; enumeration, list, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 5.30.29, M.Ant. 4.45, Gal. 6.95.
one must count, Ph. 2.488.

definition: καταρινάω or κατᾰριν-έω, v. καταρρινάω, καταρρινέω.

children.definition: squander in breakfasts: generally, squander, Antipho Soph. 73:— Pass., Com.Adesp. 1032.
Call. Fr. 357.

to be fully sufficient, χώρη οὐδεμία καταρκέει πάντα ἑωυτῇ παρέχουσα Hdt. 1.32; ἐμοὶ δὲ φῶς ἓν ἡλίου καταρκέσει E. Rh. 447; πρὸς τὰς παρασκευάς Jul. Or. 1.29c: impers., it is enough, καταρκεῖ τοῦδε κεκλῆσθαι πατρός S. Fr. 86.

data.quote: χώρη οὐδεμία καταρκέει πάντα ἑωυτῇ παρέχουσα
ἐμοὶ δὲ φῶς ἓν ἡλίου καταρκέσει

children.definition: fully sufficient, Hsch. ( -Χής cod.).
forming the beginning, ἡ δυὰς ἑτερότητος κ. Nicom. Ar. 2.17; ἡ Δημήτηρ πόλεως -κή, οἱονεὶ ἡ γῆ Lyd. Mens. 4.63, cf. Eust. 432.3.

data.quote: ἡ Δημήτηρ πόλεως -κή, οἱονεὶ ἡ γῆ

children.definition: deny strongly, persist in denying, φῄς, ἢ καταρνῇ μὴ δεδρακέναι τάδε; S. Ant. 442, cf. PFlor. 181.5 (iii A.D.).
prone to deny or raise objections, Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 18 ( Comp.).
beginning, τοῦ πάθους Archig. ap. Aët. 12.1.
plough up, τὴν γῆν Ar. Av. 582: fut. -αρόσω Jusj. ap. Poll. 8.106: 2 sg. aor. κατήροσας Hsch.
collapse, falling in, τοῦ σώματος Hp. Mul. 1.1.
rending, καταρραγαὶ πέπλων Lyc. 256.
to be remiss or idle, X. Mem. 3.5.13, D. 24.210, PHib. 1.44.4 (iii B.C.), Porph. Abst. 2.46, etc.:—also in Med., Ammon. in Cat. 7.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: neglect, τι Cod.Just. 1.2.24.16: also c. gen., Just. Nov. 22.45.3.
lose through negligence, μηδὲν κ. X. HG 6.2.39:— Pass., τὰ κατερραθυμημένα πάλιν ἀναλήψεσθε will recover ground lost through negligence, D. 4.7.
make languid, -θυμοῦντος τὴν χεῖρα τοῦ ὕπνου Philostr. Im. 1.2:— Pass., Philostr.Jun. Im. 2.

besprinkle, οἴνῳ καὶ ἐλαίῳ Hp. Art. 63; βίβλους ζωμῷ D.S. 34.1: without dat., Ath. 10.453a:— Pass. ( pf. part. καταρερασμένος), Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.504; of a spotted snake, κατέρρανται στιγμαῖς Philum. Ven. 23.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: sprinkle, ὕδωρ Gp. 2.32.1 ( Pass.):— Pass., S.E. P. 1.55.
tear into shreds: pf. part. Pass. κατερρακωμένος in rags, S. Tr. 1103.
down-swooping, κίρκος Lyc. 169, cf. 539.

definition: καταρράκτης, ου (from καταρράσσω), or κατ-ᾰράκτης (from καταράσσω, cf. Eust. 1053.5); ὦ κατᾰράκται Epigr.Gr. 979.7 ( Philae).

children.label: I
children.definition: Adj., down-rushing, ὄμβρος Str. 14.1.21.
sheer, abrupt, τὸν καταρράκτην ὀδόν S. OC 1590 (cf. Sch.; καταφράκτην Suid. s.v. ὀδός).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., waterfall, cataract, esp. of the Nile, D.S. 1.32, 17.97, Str. 17.1.2 and 49, Epigr.Gr. l.c.:— Ion. Καταρρήκτης, name of a river in Phrygia, Hdt. 7.26.
portcullis, Plu. Ant. 76, Arat. 26, D.H. 8.67.
trap-door, οἱ κ. τοῦ οὐρανοῦ ἠνεῴχθησαν LXX Ge. 7.11, cf. 4 Ki. 7.2.
movable bridge, for boarding ships, App. BC 5.82; for attacking elephants, D.H. 20.1.
sluice, Hld. 9.8.
swooping down upon its prey, Ar. Av. 887, Arist. HA 509a4, 615a28, Juba 68a, Dionys. Av. 2.2, 3.22; cormorant, Hebr. shālâkh, LXX De. 14.16(17), al.; of an eagle, S. Fr. 377; of the Harpies, ib. 714.
rushing down, swooping, Eust. 688.52.
one must besprinkle, Gp. 6.10.
Philum. Ven. 14.2 ( Pass.).
one must strike, Eust. 512.20.
one must stitch up, Antyll. (?) ap. Orib. 45.3.8.

definition: καταρραπτίτης [ῑ] (sc. ἀγών), ου, ὁ, contest at Rhodes, Gorgon 2.

children.definition: stitch on or over, θύρη κατερραμμένη ῥιπὶ καλάμων a frame lashed to a crate, Hdt. 2.96.

children.label: II
children.definition: stitch tight, τι ἔς τι Hp. Acut. 21; sew up, Thphr. HP 9.5.3; λίθον εἰς τὴν ζώνην κ. Plu. Ant. 81; in Surgery, Gal. 14.783:— Pass., Aen.Tact. 31.4; καταρρᾰφῆναι ἐν μηρῷ Agatharch. 7; τοῖς δέρμασι Sor. 1.68.
devise, compass, Πενθεῖ καταρράψας μόρον A. Eu. 26.
Ph. 2.98, etc.; ἐκτραχηλίζειν καὶ καταρράττειν Id. 1.676; ἐπάρας κατέρραξάς με LXX Ps. 101(102).10; cf. καταρρήσσω (B).

children.label: II
children.definition: Ael. NA 3.18 (s. v.l.).

definition: καταρρᾳστωνεύω, strengthd. for ῥᾳστωνεύω, Sch. Luc. Par. 41 ( Pass.).

children.definition: stitching, of an operation on the eyelid, Leonid. ap. Aët. 7.72.

children.label: II
children.definition: hem, Lyd. Mag. 2.13.
sewn together, patched, Luc. Ep.Sat. 28.

definition: καταρραχίζω, strengthd. for ῥαχίζω, Anon. in Rh. 3.577 W.
καταρρέζω, Ep. impf. καταρρέζεσκε Opp. H. 5.481:—

children.definition: pat, stroke, caress, χειρί τέ μιν κατέρεξεν ( Ep. for κατέρρ-) Il. 1.361, al., cf. A.R. 4.687: abs., καρρέζουσα ( Ep. for καταρρ-) Il. 5.424, cf. Call. Dian. 29.
endoriguum, Gloss.
lead astray, LXX Nu. 32.13 codd. AF.
weighing or pressing down , A.R. 2.593, Plu. Frig. 2.952e

sink down or to one side, hang down, Hp. Art. 43; opp. ἰσορροπέω, Plb. 6.10.7: metaph., incline, fall back upon, ἐπὶ τὸν μοναχὸν τρόπον Epicur. Ep. 2p.41U.; ἐπὶ τὴν αὐτὴν γνώμην OGI 315.51 ( Pessinus, ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: cause to incline, make to fall, τύχη γὰρ ὀρθοῖ καὶ τύχη καταρρέπει τὸν εὐτυχοῦντα τόν τε δυστυχοῦντʼ ἀεί S. Ant. 1158.

data.quote: τύχη γὰρ ὀρθοῖ καὶ τύχη καταρρέπει τὸν εὐτυχοῦντα τόν τε δυστυχοῦντʼ ἀεί

children.definition: flow down, αἷμα καταρρέον ἐξ ὠτειλῆς Il. 4.149, 5.870; κατὰ δὲ νότιος ῥέεν ἱδρὼς ὤμων καὶ κεφαλῆς 11.811; κατὰ δʼ αἷμα . . ἔρρεε χειρός 13.539; ποταμοὶ κατʼ ὄρεσφι ῥ. 4.452; καταρρέον φλέγμα ἐκ τῆς κεφαλῆς Hdt. 4.187; of rivers, παρὰ τὴν Ἄλτιν κ. X. HG 7.4.29; τὸ καταρρέον ὕδωρ D. 55.10.

data.quote: κατὰ δὲ νότιος ῥέεν ἱδρὼς ὤμων καὶ κεφαλῆς

children.definition: stream, rush down, ἁθρόοι καταρρέοντες Ar. Ach. 26; οἱ δὲ ἐμπαλασσόμενοι κατέρρεον, i. e. into the river, Th. 7.84; μὴ σφαλεὶς καταρρυῇς Ar. Pax 146, cf. 71; sink down, κ. ἀπὸ τῆς κλίνης ἐπὶ τοὺς πόδας Hp. Prog. 3; εἰς τοὺς ὁμαλοὺς τόπους Plb. 8.14.6; διὰ τοῦ τέγους κ. Luc. Tim. 41: c. acc., τὴν ἀτραπὸν κατερρύην Ar. Fr. 47.

data.quote: κ. ἀπὸ τῆς κλίνης ἐπὶ τοὺς πόδας

children.definition: fall, drop off, X. Cyr. 1.5.10, Thphr. CP 4.13.3, etc.

fall in ruins, τὰ τοιαῦτα . . περὶ αὑτὰ καταρρεῖ D. 2.10: metaph., κατερρύη τὸ τῆς πόλεως ἀνδρεῖον Arist. Fr. 557; σιγᾷ κατερρύη μέλος dub. in Pi. Fr. 177; of a crater, fall in, Plb. 34.11.12; of a roof, Paus. 1.44.3, etc.; νεκροῦ κατερρυηκότος τὰς σάρκας having collapsed, Id. 10.2.6; καταλείβεσθαί νιν καὶ κ. ὥσπερ τοὺς κολοσσούς Abh. Berl.Akad. 1925(5).21 ( Cyrene).

data.quote: καταλείβεσθαί νιν καὶ κ. ὥσπερ τοὺς κολοσσούς

children.definition: κ. ἔς τινα come to, fall to the lot of, Theoc. 1.5, Bion 1.55.
burrow, εἰς τὴν γῆν Arist. HA 556b5.
fall into, ἐπὶ τὸν μῦθον Epicur. Ep. 2p.36U.

children.label: II
children.definition: run down, drip with, φόνῳ E. Tr. 16:—and in Pass., αἵματι, ἱδρῶτι καταρρεῖσθαι, Plu. Galb. 27, Luc. Nigr. 35.

definition: καταρρήγνυμι and καταρρηγνύω, fut. -ρήξω E. HF 864: late pf. κατέρρηχα Arch.Pap. 2.125b10 (ii A. D.):—

children.definition: break down, τὴν γέφυραν Hdt. 4.201; μέλαθρα E. l.c.
tear in pieces, rend, κατερρήγνυε . . τὰ ἱμάτια D. 21.63; τὸ διάδημα D.S. 19.34; τὴν ἐσθῆτα Luc. Pisc. 36:— Med., κατερρήξαντο τοὺς κιθῶνας they rent their coats, Hdt. 8.99, cf. X. Cyr. 3.1.13, etc.
τροπὰς καταρρήγνυσι[ ἡ ἀναρχία] breaks up armies and turns them to flight, S. Ant. 675.
κ. τινῶν γέλωτας make them burst out laughing, Ath. 4.130c; cf. II.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., esp. in aor. κατερράγην [ᾰ], with pf. Act. κατέρρωγα:— to be broken down, κρημνοὶ καταρρηγνύμενοι Hdt. 7.23; καταρρήγνυσθαι ἐπὶ γῆν to be thrown down and broken, Id. 3.111; τὸ οἴκημα κατερράγη Th. 4.115; ἄκρας κατερρωγυίας εἰς τὴν θάλασσαν Str. 5.2.6.

fall, rush down, of storms, waterfalls, etc., Hp. Aër. 8; break or burst out, χειμὼν κατερράγη Hdt. 1.87; ὄμβροι καταρραγέντες Arist. Mu. 400a26; of tears, ἐξ ὀμμάτων πηγαὶ κατερρώγασι E. Alc. 1068: c. gen., τοῦ ῥεύματος -ρρηγνυμένου τῶν ὀρῶν Philostr. VA 6.23 (also intr. in Act., of a river, -ρρηγνὺς ἐς τὴν θάλατταν 3.52); of wind, Plu. Fab. 16: metaph., ὁ πόλεμος κατερράγη Ar. Eq. 644, cf. Ach. 528; γέλως Ph. 2.528; κρότος Plb. 18.46.9 (but κατερρήγνυτο πᾶς ὁ τόπος ὑπὸ τοῦ κρότου 15.32.9); βροντή Luc. VH 2.35.

data.quote: κατερρήγνυτο πᾶς ὁ τόπος ὑπὸ τοῦ κρότου

children.definition: to be broken in pieces, Αἴγυπτος μελάγγαιός τε καὶ καταρρηγνυμένη with comminuted, crumbling soil, Hdt. 2.12; γῆ κατερρωγυῖα Arist. HA 556a5; to be ruinous, ὅσα κατέρρωγεν τοῦ τείχους IG 2(2).463.75.
have a violent discharge, suffer from diarrhoea, καταρρήγνυται ἡ κοιλίη Hp. VM 10, cf. καταρράσσω II; of persons, κατερρήγνυντο τὰς γαστέρας App. Hisp. 54; ἢν μὴ φῦσαι -ρραγέωσιν Hp. Aph. 4.73.

children.label: b
children.definition: τοῖς θήλεσιν . . τὰ καταμήνια κ. Arist. HA 581b1.
break, burst, Hp. Coac. 613, Epid. 6.8.18, al.

fall in, collapse, οἵ τε μαζοὶ καὶ τὰ ἄλλα μέλεα κ. Id. Nat.Puer. 30, cf. Mul. 1.1; κατερρωγότα τὰ στέρνα [ ἔχων] flat-chested, Jul. Or. 6.198a; of the lips or tongue, to be fissured, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.27.13, Aët. 5.118.
promoting discharge, φυσέων Hp. Acut. 23 ( Comp.); οὔρων Aret. CA 1.2: abs., purgative, Hp. Acut. 51.

definition: κατάρρηξις, εως, ἡ, Medic., κ. κοιλίης

children.definition: violent diarrhoea, Hp. Coac. 235: abs., Id. Epid. 4.26.
rupture of membranes, Id. Nat.Puer. 30.
accusation, Jul. Or. 2.85d, PLond. 5.1680.9 (vi A. D.), Hsch.; condemnation, Suid.
Med., τὰς ἐσθῆτας D.S. 1.72.
overcome by rhetoric:— Pass., to be so overcome, Hyp. Dem. Fr. 7, Plu. Praec. 2.801f, Luc. Anach. 19, Agath. 5.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. peroro, Gloss.
shudder greatly, ἰδέσθαι A.R. 3.1132.
having roots below, Thphr. HP 1.6.8.

make rooted, plant firmly, τὸ θνητὸν γένος Pl. Ti. 73b; ἑαυτὸν εἰς τὴν πολιτείαν Plu. Praec. 2.805f; λᾶα AP 9.708 ( Phil.):— Pass., take root, Pl. Ti. 76c, 77c, etc.; σύριγγος -ερριζωμένης planted, terminated, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.22.10.
to be shrivelled, in pf. part. Pass., S. Ichn. 295; also glossed by συνεστραμμένον, καμπύλον γενόμενον, Suid.
hook-nosed, PPetr. 1p.51 (iii B. C.).

file down, make thin, ἰσχναίνων καὶ καταρινῶν τὰ συγκρίματα Antyll. ap. Stob. 4.37.16: metaph., κατερρινημένον τι λέγειν polished, elegant, Ar. Ra. 901; of men, βραχίονʼ εὖ κατερρινημένους, i.e. having had all superfluous flesh worked off, A. Supp. 747 ( κατερρινωμένους covered with shields, Wellauer; cf. κατερρινωμένον· καταπεπυκασμένον, καταδεδερματωμένον, Hsch.).
treatment by a blast of air, Sor. 2.41.
to be blown away, scattered, Hsch.

definition: καταρρίπτω (later καταρριπτέω Man. 4.288:— Pass., καταρειπτούμενα IG 12(3).325.41 ( Thera, ii A. D.), also pf. part. κατηρειμμένος ib. 326.20),

children.definition: throw down, overthrow, εἴ τε δημόθρους ἀναρχία βουλὴν καταρρίψειεν A. Ag. 884; τὰ βασίλεια Plu. Luc. 34, cf. Luc. Salt. 9; κ. τοὺς πολεμίους, opp. ἐπαίρω, Id. Hist.Conscr. 7.

data.quote: εἴ τε δημόθρους ἀναρχία βουλὴν καταρρίψειεν

children.definition: bring into disrepute, μάθησιν Vett.Val. 238.31; ἑαυτούς Id. 2.2.
despise, δόξαν, ἔπαινον, D.S. 13.15, 22.
flowing down, defluxion, Aesop. 145 Chambry.

children.label: II
children.definition: Arr. Epict. 1.26.16, Plu. Sanit. 2.128a, prob. in Cass.Fel. 34.
swallow up, Hsch. ( -ρυβδήσας cod., fort. recte, v. ἀναρροιβδέω).
rush hurtling against, τινος Nonn. D. 1.217, 6.116.
have a catarrh, Dsc. 1.40 (as v.l.), Gal. 6.548.
of a catarrh, catarrhal, Hp. Aph. 5.24; κ. νοσήματα Pl. Ti. 85b.

children.label: II
children.definition: subject to catarrh, Arist. Pr. 967b20.

definition: καταρροϊστικός, ή, όν, = foreg. [καταρροϊκός] II, cj. Arist. Pr. 929b27 ( -ιτικοί, -ητικοί codd.).

children.definition: down-flowing, Νεῖλος Philostr. VA 6.23.
full of streams, νῆσος Id. Im. 2.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., running from the head, catarrh, Hp. Aph. 3.12 (pl.), Pl. R. 405d (pl.), Cra. 440c, etc.: distd. from κόρυζα etc. by Gal. 7.263: metaph., Pl. Cra. 440d.
weight of a hanging body, opp. ἀναρροπίη, Hp. Art. 43.
inclining downwards, κ. ποιεῖν τι Hp. Art. 69; ἐπὶ τὸ κ. ῥέπειν ibid.; pendent, φύματα Hp. Epid. 6.1.10, cf. Gal. 7.567, 15.330.
sloping, κλίνη Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.14.6.
tending to descend, νοῦσος Hp. Hum. 5, 7.
gulp or swallow down, Hp. Morb. 2.54, 59.

definition: καταρροφέω, = foreg., Hp. Loc.Hom. 17, X. Cyr. 1.3.9, Arist. Pr. 876a27, Herm.Iamb. 4; τινος some of . . , Orib. 8.6.16:— Pass., Ruf. Sat.Gon. 18:—later καταρ-ροφάω, Alex.Trall. 11.2, Sm. Jb. 39.30.

children.definition: swallowing, Sor. 2.41, Dsc. Eup. 2.5.
subject to catarrh, Hp. Vict. 1.32.
slipping away: hence, dripping with fat, μηροί S. Ant. 1010.

bring into rhythm, Hld. 3.3; τὰ κατερρυθμισμένα passages over-rhythmical, Longin. 41.2: metaph., κ. τινὰ (neut.) ἐς τὴν τοῦ δικαίου δόξαν Philostr. VA 7.18:— Pass., γέροντα εἰς βίον ἥμερον Ath. 5.179a.
very rhythmical, Longin. 41.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: κατάρυθμος, prob. f. l. for κακόρρυθμος in Paul.Aeg. 2.11.

defile, sully, ταῖς κατηγορίαις τὰς εὐεργεσίας l.c., cf. Pl. Lg. 919e, 937d; ἑαυτόν Arist. Ath. 6.3, cf. Lib. Or. 64.41; ἀκόλαστα ῥήματα τοὺς λέγοντας κ. Plu. Cohib. 2.456c; βραχείᾳ κηλῖδι τοὺς πόνους κ. Chor. Milt. 64.
= foreg., David Proll. 40.20: metaph., δικαστήριον Lyd. Mag. 3.66:— Pass., to be soiled and dirty, of a dress, SIG 1219.6 ( Gambreum, iii B. C.).
κατερρυπωμένος, = destitutus, Gloss.
flowing down, of soap into the eyes, Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.60; of phlegm, Mich. in PN 78.17.
sinking down, Gal. 18(2).702.
become wrinkled, EM 737.1.

irrigated, watered, κῆπος E. El. 777; νάπη χιόνι κατάρυτα Id. Tr. 1067 (lyr.), cf. Andr. 215; γῆ ἔνδροσός τε καὶ κ. Ael. NA 10.37; λίμνη κ. αἵματι LXX 2 Ma. 12.16; ὄρος κ. channelled by streams, OGI 199.12 ( Adule).
flowing, ὕδωρ Olymp. in Mete. 128.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: carried down by water, alluvial, of the Delta, Hdt. 2.15.

children.label: III
children.definition: with a steep slope, of a testudo, Plb. 28.11.2.
fear, dread, τι Hdt. 1.34, 80, al.; τινας Id. 9.8; ὑπέρ τινος Id. 7.178: abs., Id. 8.75, 103; κ. μὴ . . Id. 9.45.
jagged, broken, πέτραι S. Ph. 937; of earth, friable, prob. l. in Hsch. ( -ρόγεα cod.).
landing, bringing to land, opp. ἄπαρσις, Poll. 1.102; but usu. landing-place, Th. 4.26, Plu. Pomp. 65, D.C. 60.11, Ael. VH 9.16.
hang up, suspend, Plu. Rom. 16; τὶ ἔκ τινος Id. Marc. 8:— Pass., to be suspended, Arist. Pr. 874a18; κατήρτηντο βότρυσιν were hung thick with grapes, Luc. Am. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: fasten, adjust, χρῆμα κατηρτημένον a well-adjusted or convenient thing, Hdt. 3.80; κατήρτητο became normal, recovered sense, Hp. Epid. 1.4.8 [1.26.ηʹ]; οὐδὲν -ημένον λέγειν to talk no connected sense, Id. Acut.(Sp.) 16:—later in Act., τῇ θεῷ κατάρτησον σαυτήν Herod. 1.62.
PSI 9.1030.6 (ii A. D.), POxy. 1208.14 (iii A.D.); written καταρθία and καταρτ-εία PLond. 3.1164 ( h) 17, 25 (iii A.D.), PSI 9.1072.10 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Artem. 2.53.

adjust, put in order, restore, πάντα ἐς τὠυτό Hdt. 5.106; Μίλητος νοσήσασα στάσι, μέχρι οὗ μιν Πάριοι κατήρτισαν ib. 28, cf. 30; τὸν δῆμον Plu. Marc. 10; ἵνα καταρτισθῇ [ ἡ πόλις] D.H. 3.10; κ. δίκτυα mend, Ev.Matt. 4.21; set a dislocated limb, in Pass., Apollon.Cit. 2, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.1.3 ( Act. and Pass.); but κ. τὴν ὀσφὺν καὶ τοὺς ὤμους form them by exercise, Arr. Epict. 3.20.10: metaph., restore to a right mind, Ep.Gal. 6.1; κ. τινὰ εἰς τὸ συμφέρον Plu. Cat.Mi. 65; reconcile, φίλους διαφερομένους Eus.Mynd. 1; make good, τὰ ὑστερήματα τῆς πίστεως 1 Ep.Thess. 3.10:— Med., ἠσθένησε, σὺ δὲ κατηρτίσω αὐτήν LXX Ps. 67(68).10.

children.label: II
children.definition: furnish, equip, τετρήρη πληρώματι Plb. 1.47.6, al., cf. PTeb. 6.7 ( ii B.C., Pass.), D.S. 13.70, etc.:— Pass., πλοῖα ταῖς εἰρεσίαις κατηρτισμένα Plb. 5.2.11; κατηρτισμένος abs., in battle array, Hdt. 9.66; instructed, Ev.Luc. 6.40; prepare, make ready, σφενδόνην Ph. Bel. 78.24:— Med., LXX Ex. 15.17, al.: σῶμα κατηρτίσω μοι Ep.Hebr. 10.5; ὁ τὸν κόσμον καταρτισάμενος PMag.Par. 1.1147: c. inf., κατηρτίσατο δίδοσθαι OGI 177.10 ( Egypt, i B.C.):—so in Pass., ib. 179.8 (ibid., i B.C.): abs. in imper., καταρτίζεσθε 2 Ep.Cor. 13.11.
compound, prepare dishes, medicines, etc., Dsc. Alex.Praef. codd. (v. καταρτύω):— Med., Nic. Th. 954.
mast, EM 478.23:—also κατάρτ-ιος, ἡ, but distd. from ἱστός, Artem. 2.12, 53, EM l.c., Gloss.
part of the loom, Artem. 3.36.
restoration, 2 Ep.Cor. 13.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: training, discipline, Plu. Alex. 7.

children.label: III
children.definition: Paul.Aeg. 6.99.
finished product, Gloss. (pl.).
restoration, reconciliation, Sm. Is. 38.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: Settling of a limb, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.1.1 (pl.), Sor. 1.73 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: furnishing, preparation, αὐλῆς PTeb. 33.12 (ii B.C.); ἱματίον PRyl. 127.28 (i A.D.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: training, discipline, τῶν ἁγίων Ep.Eph. 4.12.
one who restores order, mediator, Hdt. 4.161, 5.28, Them. Or. 4.61c.
training, discipline, παιδεία καὶ κ. Plu. Them. 2; ψυχῶν Iamb. VP 16.68, cf. 20.95.
= confectio, Gloss.
prepare, dress, of food, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 44; τὴν ξεινίην Hp. Ep. 12:— Pass., τὰ -τυμένα τῶν ἐδεσμάτων restored in Dsc. Alex.Praef. fr. Paul.Aeg. 5.28.

train, discipline, τὴν φύσιν Plu. Aud. 2.38d: c. inf., καταρτύσων μολεῖν to procure his coming, S. OC 71:— Pass., καταρτύεται νόος ἀνδρός Sol. 27.11; σμικρῷ χαλινῷ δʼ οἶδα . . ἵππους καταρτυθέντας S. Ant. 478; παῖς ἔχει πηγὴν τοῦ φρονεῖν μήπω κατηρτυμένην Pl. Lg. 808d; μανθανόμενα καὶ καταρτυόμενα Id. Men. 88b; τὸ πρεσβύτερον καὶ κατηρτ. Junc. ap. Stob. 4.50.9.

data.quote: σμικρῷ χαλινῷ δʼ οἶδα . . ἵππους καταρτυθέντας
παῖς ἔχει πηγὴν τοῦ φρονεῖν μήπω κατηρτυμένην

children.definition: equip, λέμβος . . ἐρέταις κατηρτυμένος Alciphr. 1.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: pf. part., κατηρτῡκώς thoroughly furnished, full-grown, used of horses which have lost their foalʼs-teeth, Hsch., cf. E. Fr. 41, AB 105 (so in pres. οἱ καταρτύοντες τῶν ἵππων Philostr. VA 7.23); κάμηλος τῷ σώματι κατηρτυκώς BGU 13.5 (iii A.D.); also of men, τὸ κατηρτυκέναι Philostr. VA 5.33: metaph., κατηρτυκὼς . . ἱκέτης προσῆλθες a perfected suppliant, one who has done all that is required, or one that is broken in like a horse tamed, A. Eu. 473: c. gen., ἀμβλύς εἰμι καὶ κατηρτυκὼς κακῶν tamed, broken in spirit by them, E. Fr. 821.5. [ ῡ, exc. in Sol. l.c.]
κατάρῠτος, ον, = κατάρρυτος (q.v.).
beat in an election, esp. by unfair means, τινα Plu. CG 11:—metaph. in Pass., to be corrupted as by office, Longin. 44.9.
beginning, πράγματος BGU 1209.11 (i B.C.), cf. Callicr. ap. Stob. 4.28.16, Plb. 2.12.8; κ. διαφορᾶς Id. 22.4.14, al.; ἀνέμου Mim. Oxy. 413.213.

children.label: II
children.definition: forecast of an undertaking, voyage, etc., Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.99, Vett.Val. 187.15 (pl.); περὶ καταρχῶν, title of poems by Maximus and Heph.Astr.

children.label: III
children.definition: part of victim first offered, IG 2(2).1359.

children.label: IV
children.definition: primacy, sovereignty, τοῦ ἁθρόου Epicur. Fr. 314; starting-point, basis, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.246; τὰς Χάριτας [ εἶναι] τὰς ἡμετέρας κ. Phld. Piet. 14.
founder, creator, γῆς PMag.Par. 1.713.
pertaining to καταρχαί II, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.41.

make beginning of a thing, c.gen., τίνες κατῆρξαν . . μάχης; A. Pers. 351; ὁδοῦ κατάρχειν lead the way, S. OC 1019; δεινοῦ λόγου Id. Tr. 1135; λόγων χρησίμων Ar. Lys. 638, cf. Pl. Prt. 351e, etc.; τραυμάτων Ascl. Tact. 7.1; τὸ κατάρχον αἰσθήσεως, τῆς κινήσεως, the source of perception, of motion, Gal. 5.588: rarely c. acc., begin a thing, θαυμαστόν τινα λόγον Pl. Euthd. 283b: c. part., begin doing, X. Cyr. 1.4.4, 4.5.58: abs., Pl. Smp. 177e, Arist. Mu. 399a15.
θανόντα δεσπόταν γόοις κατάρξω I will lead the dirge over . . , E. Andr. 1199 (lyr., with reference to the religious sense, infr. II.2).

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., begin, like Act., c. gen., ἐχθρᾶς ἡμέρας κατάρχεται Id. Ph. 540; τοῖς κατηργμένοις τῆς πορείας Pl. Phdr. 256d; κ. τῆς προσβολῆς Plb. 2.67.1; τοῦ λόγου Plu. Symp. 2.151e: c. acc., κ. νόμον, στεναγμόν, E. Hec. 685 (s. v. l.), Or. 960 (both lyr.): abs., κατάρχεται μέλος is beginning, Id. HF 750 (lyr.), cf. 891 (lyr.); τὸ -άρξασθαι Ael. Tact. 17.

begin the sacrificial ceremonies, once in Hom., Νέστωρ χέρνιβά τʼ οὐλοχύτας τε κατήρχετο Nestor began [the sacrifice ] with the washing of hands and sprinkling the barley on the victimʼs head, Od. 3.445: abs., Hdt. 4.60, 103, And. 1.126; κατάρχομαι μέν, σφάγια δʼ ἄλλοισιν μέλει I begin the rite, but leave the slaughter of the victim to others, E. IT 40; ἐπὶ τῶν θυσιῶν κριθαῖς κ. D.H. 2.25: c. gen., κατάρχεσθαι τοῦ τράγου make a beginning of the victim, i.e. consecrate him for sacrifice by cutting off the hair of his forehead, Ar. Av. 959; ἐπεὶ δὲ αὐτοῦ (sc. Ἡρακλέος) πρὸς τῷ βωμῷ κατάρχοντο Hdt. 2.45; πῶς δʼ αὖ κατάρξῃ θυμάτων; E. Ph. 573, cf. IT 56, 1154; κατάρξασθαι τῶν ἱερῶν D. 21.114: metaph., σκυτάλην λαβών μου κατήρξατο Luc. Somn. 3, cf. Plu. Caes. 66:—so later in Act., Hld. 2.34, al.

data.quote: Νέστωρ χέρνιβά τʼ οὐλοχύτας τε κατήρχετο Nestor

children.label: b
children.definition: sacrifice, slay, ξίφει, φασγάνῳ κ., E. Alc. 74, El. 1222 (lyr.):— Pass., ᾗ (sc. τῇ θεᾷ) σὸν κατῆρκται σῶμα hath been devoted, Id. Heracl. 601.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., rule, govern, c. gen., Alciphr. 3.44 (s.v.l.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: κατάρξω ὑμᾶς ἐν σκορπίοις will chastise you . . , LXX 3 Ki. 12.24r.
throw into a bath, ἐσθῆτας PMasp. 9 ii 29 (vi A.D.).
fleshy, plump, Agatharch. Fr.Hist. 7 J., Sor. 2.57, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.12.8, Alciphr. Fr. 5.3; gloss on σωμασκίας, Hdn. Epim. 130.
plumpness, Eust. 1656.42.
stamp down, τὴν γῆν Thphr. CP 5.6.2: pf. part. Pass. κατασεσασμένα, glossed by κατασεσεισμένα, Hsch.

definition: κατασβέννυμι or κατασβεννύω, Ion. aor. inf. -σβῶσαι Herod. 5.39:—

children.definition: put out, quench, κατέσβεσε θεσπιδαὲς πῦρ Il. 21.381, cf. 16.293 (tm.), E. Or. 697, etc.: metaph., ἔστιν θάλασσα, τίς δέ νιν κατασβέσει; who shall dry it up? A. Ag. 958, cf. Th. 584; κ. βοήν, ἔριν, quell noise, strife, S. Aj. 1149, OC 422; ἀνομίαν Critias 25.40 D.; τὰς ἡδονάς Pl. Lg. 838b; τὴν δυσχέρειαν Id. Prt. 334c; τὴν ταραχήν X. Cyr. 5.3.55; χολήν Herod. l.c.; κ. τὰ τραύματα heal them, Luc. DMar. 11.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., fut. -σβήσομαι (v. infr.), with aor. 2 and pf. Act., go out, be quenched, καιόμενον τὸν χρυσὸν κατασβῆναι ( aor. 2) Hdt. 4.5; κατασβεσθῆναι τὴν πυρήν Id. 1.87; ὁ κάνθαρος (i. e. the Sun) -σβήσεται PMag.Leid.V. 2.18: metaph., κλαυμάτων πηγαὶ . . κατεσβήκασι A. Ag. 888; of tumours, κατέσβη Hp. Epid. 1.1; κατασβεννύμενος, of passion, Pl. R. 411c; κατασβεσθεὶς ταῖς ἐλπίσιν Plu. Superst. 2.168f; of the wind, Id. Tim. 19.
putting out, D.C. 54.2.
one must quench, Plu. An seni 2.787f.
shaking, Hp. Art. 43; τῆς κεφαλῆς Gal. 10.1019.

definition: κατασεισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Sor. 1.60 (pl.), Archig. ap. Gal. 12.657, Aët. 6.87.

children.definition: one must shake, Sor. 1.65.

definition: κατασείω, fut. -σείσω Hp. Art. 43: pf. -σέσεικα Philem. 84:—

children.definition: shake down, throw down, οἰκοδομήματος ἐπὶ μέγα Th. 2.76; τεῖχος, τοῦ τείχους ἐπὶ μέγα, Arr. An. 1.19.2, 2.23.1; σεισμὸς κ. τὴν πόλιν Ael. VH 6.7 :— Pass., fall down, Ph. 2.512; of a lionʼs mane, αὐχένος ἐκ λασίοιο χαίτη -εσείετο Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.21: metaph., κ. ἀκροατοῦ ὦτα Philostr. VS 2.29; νόμους Procop. Arc. 27.33; κατέσεισεν ἅπαντα καὶ κατεβρόντησε Eun. Hist. p.256 D.; ἕως κατέσεισε until he laid him on the floor (with drinking), Men. 8, cf. Philem. l.c., Ath. 10.431c.
impel, drive headlong, νεανίσκον εἰς τὸν μανιώδη καὶ σφαλερὸν τῆς βασιλείας ἔρωτα Eun. Hist. p.235 D., cf. p.267 D.:— Pass., πρὸς τὸ λέγειν κ. ib. p.223 D.

data.quote: νεανίσκον εἰς τὸν μανιώδη καὶ σφαλερὸν τῆς βασιλείας ἔρωτα

children.definition: treat by shaking, Hp. Art. 42:— Pass., ib. 43.

κατασείσας τὴν χεῖρα with a motion of the hand, Act.Ap. 19.33; κ. ἱκετηρίας J. BJ 2.21.8; κ. τὰ ἱμάτια, by way of signal, Plu. Pomp. 73: more freq. c. dat., κ. τῇ χειρί beckon with the hand, Plb. 1.78.3, Hld. 10.7; κ. τῇ χειρὶ σιγᾶν Act.Ap. 12.17; κ. τῷ λύχνῳ ἅμα λέγων τὸν λόγον PMag.Lond. 46.453; κ. ὀθόναις Hld. 9.6: abs., κ. τινί beckon to another, as a sign for him to be silent, X. Cyr. 5.4.4; κ. τισὶν ἐπεξιέναι J. AJ 17.10.2; but also, shake the head in token of contempt, Phld. Vit. p.37 J.

data.quote: κ. τῷ λύχνῳ ἅμα λέγων τὸν λόγον

children.definition: to be libidinous, Suid. s.v. καταπυγῶν.
rush down along, c. acc., κῦμα κατέσσυτο καλὰ ῥέεθρα Il. 21.382: abs., rush down, κατεσσύμενος Q.S. 4.270.
rush against, κατεσσεύεσθε λεόντων Nonn. D. 5.353.
strain through a sieve, Hp. Mul. 2.133:— Pass., aor. part. -σησθεῖσα Gp. 12.17.1.
strew, ναόν [ τέφρᾳ] Thd. Bel. 14.

cause to be sealed up, ὄφεις . . ἐν κίστῃ που κατασήμηναι Ar. Fr. 28; [ ἐχίνους] Arist. Ath. 53.2; χρυσίον Pl. Men. 89b; ὑδρίαν IG 2(2).204.39:— Pass., ib. 41; τὰς ἐπισκήψεις φυλάττειν -σεσημασμένας ὑπʼ ἀμφοῖν Pl. Lg. 937b, ib. 756c:— Pass., τὰ κατασημανθέντα ὀνόματα ib. 756e, cf. Arist. Ath. 49.2.
marking distinctly, Longin. 32.5.
Klio 17.187 ( Delph., i A.D.), cf. Hsch.

cause or allow to rot, X. Cyr. 8.2.21:— Pass., rot away, ib. 8.2.22; μὴ . . κατὰ χρόα πάντα σᾰπήῃ Il. 19.27; ἕως ἂν κατασαπῇ Pl. Phd. 86d; -σαπέντων τῶν καρπῶν CPHerm. 6.16 (iii A.D.): so in pf. -σέσηπα Ar. Pl. 1035, Philetaer. 9.
cause or allow to linger, τοὺς ἀνθρώπους ἐν τοῖς πάθεσι Gal. 10.264:— Pass., pine away, -σήπεσθαι ἐπὶ τῆς κλίνης ib. 263; πρὸς ταῖς ἀλλοτρίαις θύραις -σαπῆναι Arr. Epict. 4.10.20.
to be or grow weak, οἱ κατησθενηκότες Aët. 9.42, cf. Sor. 2.11, Erot. s.v. κατηπέδανον.
weaken, κνησμονάς App.Anth. 3.158.
pant, struggle against, c. gen., ἵππος χαλινῶν ὣς κατασθμαίνων μένει A. Th. 393.
put to silence, Arist. HA 614a20, Ael. VH 14.9; τὸν δῆμον Hdn. 1.9.3; σάλπιγγα Ael. NA 16.23:— Pass., Posidon. 36 J.; τὰ Πινδάρου ἤδη κατασεσιγασμένα not now perused, Ath. 1.3a (cf. Eup. 366).
silence, calm, Hsch. s.v. πραΰνει.
of or for silencing, Eust. 197.48.
remain silent, Pl. Phd. 107a.

children.label: II
children.definition: CPHerm. 25ii2, Luc. JTr. 13 (v.l. -σιώπησον).
plate with iron, κριοὶ κατασεσιδηρωμένοι D.S. 13.54, cf. Bito 53.7, Str. 15.3.11.
Sicilize the cheese (in allusion to the peculations of Laches in Sicily), Ar. V. 911, cf. Sch.ad loc.
mock at, Hp. Praec. 8.
Gloss.
injure, damage, Hsch.: aor. 1 part., κατασινάμενος τὰ κάλλιστα τῆς χώρας prob. l. in Malch. p.407 D.
keep silence, Isoc. 8.38, Arist. Rh. 1413b7, J. Ap. 2.33, etc.; εἰδότες κ, Arist. Ath. 14.2; πρός τι D. 41.23.
keep silent, pass over, τὸ γεγονός D.S. 32.10:— Pass., Isoc. 4.27.
condemn by silence, πόλιν D.Chr. 32.98.

children.label: II
children.definition: make silent, silence, τὴν γυναῖκα X. HG 5.4.7, cf. Luc. Bis Acc. 17, Anach. 19, Dom. 16:— Med., cause silence, X. HG 2.4.20; κατασιωπήσασθαι διὰ τοῦ σαλπιγκτοῦ τὸν θόρυβον Plb. 18.46.9.

data.quote: κατασιωπήσασθαι διὰ τοῦ σαλπιγκτοῦ τὸν θόρυβον

children.definition: one must keep silence, Isoc. 12.96.
bound up and down, Opp. H. 4.322.
dig down, ἐπὶ θάτερα τῆς ἀμπέλου Thphr. HP 4.13.5; but usu.,

children.label: II
children.definition: destroy utterly, raze to the ground, τὸ ἄστυ Hdt. 7.156; Τροίαν κ. βίᾳ S. Ph. 998, cf. A. Ag. 525; πάτραν S. OC 1421; δόμους E. HF 566; πόλιν SIG 344.7 ( Teos, iv B.C.), cf. D. 18.71; το τέγος Ar. Nu. 1488; τὰ τείχη ἐς ἔδαφος Th. 4.109, cf. Lys. 12.40, Isoc. l.c., Arist. Ath. 37.1; τὸν λιμένα Aeschin. 3.123; τὰ θυσιαστήρια LXX 3 Ki. 19.10; τὴν οἰκίαν εἰς ἔδαφος Plu. Publ. 10, etc.:— Pass., ϝοικία κατασκαπτέσθω Berl.Sitzb. 1927.8 ( Locr., v B.C.); τὰ οἱκία οἱ κατεσκάφη Hdt. 6.72; πατρῴα ἑστία κατεσκάφη E. Hec. 22; τὰ κατεσκαμμένα ἀναστήσω LXX Am. 9.11.
peck at, Ath. 11.507c.

razing to the ground, destruction, S. OC 1318, Th. 5.63; τειχῶν Lys. 13.8; ἀκροπόλεως SIG 285.9 ( Erythrae, iv B.C.): more freq. in pl., Ἰλίου κ. E. Hel. 196 (lyr.); ἰὼ κ. δόμων A. Ch. 50 (lyr.); πόλει κατασκαφὰς θέντες Id. Th. 46; πύργων κ. E. Ph. 1196; τειχῶν Aeschin. 3.157.

children.label: II
children.definition: that which is dug, esp. grave, in pl., θάπτειν . . γῆς . . κατασκαφαῖς A. Th. 1013, cf. 1042; ἐς θανόντων . . κατασκαφάς S. Ant. 920.
dug down, κ. οἴκησις the deep-dug dwelling, i. e. the grave, S. Ant. 891.

definition: κατασκάφιλος καταισχύνων τοὺς φίλους, Hsch. (leg. καταισχόφιλος).
κατασκεδάζω, = sq., Suid.:— Pass., Sch. E. Hec. 916.
κατασκεδάννυμι and κατασκεδαννύω ( D. 54.4 codd.), Att. fut. -σκεδῶ Antiph. 25:—

children.definition: scatter, pour upon or over, κατάχυσμα . . κατεσκέδασαν θερμὸν τοῦτο καθʼ ὑμῶν Ar. Av. 536, cf. PMagd. 33.4 (iii B.C.); τὰς ἀμίδας D. l.c.: usu. c. acc. et gen., τὴν μεγίστην ἀρύταιναν ὑμῶν Antiph. l.c., etc.; ὥσπερ ἑωλοκρασίαν τινά μου τῆς πονηρίας -σκεδάσας D. 18.50; κ. ὕβριν τινός pour abuse upon one, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10c; λῆρον κ. τινός Luc. Salt. 6; ὅλας ἁμάξας βλασφημιῶν κ. τινός Id. Eun. 2, etc.

data.quote: κατάχυσμα . . κατεσκέδασαν θερμὸν τοῦτο καθʼ ὑμῶν
ὥσπερ ἑωλοκρασίαν τινά μου τῆς πονηρίας -σκεδάσας

children.definition: κ. φήμην spread a report against one, Pl. Ap. 18c:— Pass., ἡ φήμη κατεσκέδασται τοῦ Μίνω Id. Min. 320d; ὁ λόγος ἐν τῇ πόλει κατεσκέδασται (prob. l. for -σκεύασται) Lys. 10.23; τοῦ πόνου πλείονος -ασμένου τῆς σαρκός Hp. Medic. 7.
Med., pour, sprinkle about, X. An. 7.3.32 ( Suid., Phot.: συγκατ-) codd.).
overthrow, destroy, IG 12(9).1179.9 ( Euboea).

reduce to a skeleton, ἑαυτούς Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7d; τὸ σῶμα Sch. Ar. Ra. 153:— Pass., to be wasted away, ‘desiccated,ʼ μὴ περιιδεῖν τὴν φύσιν -ευθεῖσαν Isoc. 15.268, cf. Ph. 1.198, al., Onos. 1.5 ( Act.), D.L. 8.41: metaph., τὰ φυσικὰ ἔργα ταῖς τεχνολογίαις -ευόμενα Longin. 2.1.
meagre, of style, D.H. Isoc. 2; τὸ τῶν παρʼ ἡμῖν ἐπιτεχνημάτων κ. the meagreness or inadequacy of human contrivances. Ptol. Alm. 13.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: hard, difficult, μέθοδος Id. Harm. 2.13, cf. 2.2.

become a skeleton, wither away, φαρμάκων χρείᾳ κατεσκέλλοντο A. Pr. 481: mostly in pf. Act. κατέσκληκα, Thphr. CP 6.14.11, Luc. Gall. 29, Gal. UP 8.7, etc.; ὑπὸ τῶν πόνων Alciphr. 3.19, cf. Luc. Bis Acc. 34: plpf., λιμῶ κατεσκλήκει Babr. 46.8; to be hard or frozen, Thphr. l.c.: metaph., -εσκληκώς austere, Philostr. VS 1.18.1.
cover entirely, Aen.Tact. 37.3, Thphr. HP 9.3.2, J. AJ 8.4.1: pf. inf. Pass. κατεσκεπάσθαι Artem. 2.32.
μοχθηρὰ ἤθη λόγοις ἐπιεικέσιν κ. Ph. 2.341.
covering, Al. Ex. 26.36.
one must cover, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.85.
covered, Aq. Nu. 7.3.
Just. Nov. 22 Praef.: impf., Plb. 3.94.7.
AP 5.59 ( Rufin.), Muson. Fr. 19p.106H.

definition: κατασκευάζω, fut. -σκευάσω, Att. -σκευῶ SIG 1097.9 ( Athens, iv B.C.), IPE 12.32 B53 ( Olbia, iii B.C.): Dor. aor. -εσκεύαξα Ti.Locr. 94d, Test.Epict. 1.14, also κατεσκέαξα Africa Italiana 1.330 ( Cyrene): Boeot. aor. inf. -σκευάττη SIG 1185.13 ( Tanagra, iii B.C.): pf. -εσκεύᾰκα D. 42.30: fut. Med. 3 sg. -ᾶται SIG 1015.28 (Halic.): Dor. aor. Med. -εσκευαξάμην Test.Epict. 1.9:—

children.definition: equip, furnish fully with . . , [ πᾶσι] κ. τὸ πλοῖον with all appliances, D. 18.194:— Med., τοὺς ἵππους χαλκοῖς . . προβλήμασι κ. X. Cyr. 6.1.51:—freq. in Pass., ἱρὸν θησαυροῖσί τε καὶ ἀναθήμασι κατεσκευασμένον Hdt. 8.33, cf. 2.44; κατασκευὴ χρυσῶ τε καὶ ἀργύρω κατεσκ. Id. 9.82; οἷς ἡ χώρα κατεσκεύασται Th. 6.91.

data.quote: ἱρὸν θησαυροῖσί τε καὶ ἀναθήμασι κατεσκευασμένον

children.definition: furnish, equip fully, τὴν χώραν X. An. 1.9.19; κ. τινὰ ἐπὶ στρατιάν Id. Cyr. 3.3.3; [ ἐλέφαντας] κ. πρὸς τὴν πολεμικὴν χρείαν OGI 54.12 ( Adule, iii B.C.):— Med., κ. τοὺς ὄνους having got his asses ready, Hdt. 2.121.δʹ, etc.:— Pass., τῆς Ἀντάνδρου μελλούσης -σκευάζεσθαι Th. 4.75, cf. 8.24; ἔργα -ασμένα cultivated farms, Anaxag. 4; of persons, to be under treatment, Phld. Lib. p.3 O., al.

construct, build, γέφυραν Hdt. 1.186 ( Pass.); διδασκαλεῖον Antipho 6.11; πόλιν Pl. R. 557d; γυμνάσια Id. Lg. 761c; ἱερὰ θυσίας τε αὑτοῖς κ. Id. Criti. 113c; ἐπιτείχισμʼ ἐπὶ τὴν Ἀττικήν D. 18.71: generally, prepare, arrange, establish, κ. δημοκρατίαν X. HG 2.3.36; δύναμιν τῇ πόλει And. 3.39; συμπόσιον Pl. R. 363c; ἰσότητα τῆς οὐσίας Id. Lg. 684d, cf. Arist. Pol. 1265a39; ὀλιγαρχίαν Id. Ath. 37.1; ναύτας D. 50.36; κ. τινὰς μελέτῃ train them, X. Cyr. 8.1.43, etc.; turn out, πολιτικούς Phld. Rh. 2.264 S., al.:— Med., κατασκευάζεσθαι ναυμαχίαν prepare it, make ready for it, v.l. for παρασκ- in Th. 2.85; make for oneself, esp. build a house and furnish it, opp. ἀνασκευάζομαι Id. 1.93, 2.17; unpack, opp. ἀνασκ., X. Cyr. 8.5.2; κ. ἐρημίαν αὑτῶ Pl. Lg. 730c, etc.; κ. τράπεζαν set up a bank, Is. Fr. 66; κατασκευάζομαι τέχνην μυρεψικήν I am setting up as a perfumer, Lys. Fr. 1.2; τοὺς ἐγγυτάτω τῆς ἀγορᾶς κατεσκευασμένους Id. 24.20; [ πρόσοδον] οὐ μικρὰν κατεσκευάσαντο made themselves a good [income], D. 27.61, cf. And. 4.11.

fabricate, trump up, πρόφασιν X. Cyr. 2.4.17; τὸ ἀπόρρητον κατασκευάσαι D. 2.6; λιποταξίου γραφὴν κατεσκεύασεν Id. 21.103, cf.92; χρέα ψευδῆ Id. 42.30, cf. 45.22 ( Pass.); of persons, suborn, λογοποιούς Din. 1.35; set up, ἢ . . ἐπιτίθενται αὐτοὶ ἢ κατασκευάζουσιν ἕτερον Arist. Pol. 1306a1; οἱ κατεσκευασμένοι τῶν Θετταλῶν men prepared for the purpose, D. 18.151; κατεσκ. δανεισταί Id. 42.28: c. inf., τὸν ἀνεψιὸν . . κατεσκεύασεν ἀμφισβητεῖν Id. 55.1.

data.quote: ἢ . . ἐπιτίθενται αὐτοὶ ἢ κατασκευάζουσιν ἕτερον

children.definition: make, render, [ φρούρια] κ. ὡς ἐχυρώτατα X. Cyr. 2.4.17; ἀριστερὰ δεξιῶν ἀσθενέστερα κ, Pl. Lg. 795a; φοβερὸν κ. τὸ αὐτόχειρα γενέσθαι D. 20.158; ἀνομοθέτητον ἑαυτῶ τὸν βίον Duris 10 J.; κ. τινὰ τοιοῦτον . . Arist. Rh. 1380a2 (also with Adv., πρὸς ἑαυτὸν κ. εὖ τὸν ἀκροατήν render the audience favourably disposed towards oneself, 1419b11).
represent as so and so, κ. τινὰς παροίνους, ὑβριστάς, ἀγνώμονας, D. 54.14, cf. 45.82; εἰ μὴ Γοργίαν Νέστορά τινα κατασκευάζεις unless you make out a Gorgias to be Nestor, Pl. Phdr. 261c.

maintain, prove, τῶν ἐν Εὐβοίᾳ πραγμάτων . . ὡς ἐγὼ αἴτιός εἰμι, κατεσκεύαζε tried to make out that . . , D. 21.110; κ. ὅτι . . Arr. Epict. 3.15.14, S.E. P. 1.32; κ. τῶ λόγῳ establish a proposition by reasoning, Damian. Opt. 5; διὰ λόγου -σκευασθήσεται Phld. Sign. 6.

construct a positive argument, opp. ἀναιρέω, ἀνασκευάζω (of negative arguments), Arist. Rh. 1401b3, cf. Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1036b, etc.: Philos., κ. τῶν ἀριθμῶν ἰδέαν construct, postulate, Arist. EN 1096a19, cf. Metaph. 984b25, al.
construct, Euc. 5.7 ( Pass.), Archim. Sph.Cyl. 2.6 ( Pass.); solve by a construction, πρόβλημα Papp. 54.25.
frame, ὀνόματα D.H. Comp. 16; elaborate, κατεσκεύασται τὸ δοκοῦν εἶναι ἀφελές Id. Is. 7; λόγος κατεσκευασμένος Str. 1.2.6.
Med., prepare oneself or make ready for doing, ὡς πολεμήσοντες Th. 2.7; ὡς οἰκήσων X. An. 3.2.24; ὡς εἰς μάχην Paus. 5.21.14.
Pass., of disease, to become established, -σκευαζομένου τοῦ πάθους Gal. 8.332.
preparation of drugs, Suid. s.v. κῦφι.

that which is prepared or made, work of art, τὰ Κορίνθια κ. Hippoloch. ap. Ath. 4.128d, cf. Plb. 4.18.8, Aristeas 52, J. BJ 7.5.5, Arr. Epict. 2.19.26; surgical apparatus, Orib. 49.24.2; esp. building, structure, D. 23.207, SIG 330.39 (pl., Ilium, iv B.C.), Plb. 10.27.9, D.H. 3.27, D.S. 1.50; οἰκητήριον κ. Cleanth.Stoic. 1.132; θεωρητὸν κ., of the world, Secund. Sent. 1: in pl., engines of war, Plb. 1.48.5; furniture, ἱεροῦ SIG 330.4 ( Ilium, iv B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: arrangement, contrivance, D. 23.13; τὸ κ. τῶν συσσιτίων Arist. Pol. 1271a33; τὰ [ τυραννικὰ] κ. ib. 1319b27; σοφιστοῦ Phld. Rh. 1.183 S.; ἐκ κατασκευάσματος, Lat. ex composito, D.C. 52.7.
Dim. of foreg. [κατασκεύασμα], Hero Spir. 1.7.
contrivance, D. 24.16; ἐκ κατασκευασμοῦ, Lat. ex composito, D.C. 38.9, al.
to be prepared or made, X. Ages. 1.23, Gal. 14.262.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must prepare, make, etc., Pl. Lg. 964d, X. HG 3.4.15, etc.; κ. ἔθος πρὸς τὸν ἔμετον Philum. ap. Aët. 9.23.
one must construct a proof or argument, Aphth. Prog. 6, Theon Prog. 3.
contriver, Hsch. and Suid. s.v. μηχανορράφος.
one who makes provision, commissariat officer, quartermaster, Just. Nov. 30.7.1.
fitted for providing, τινος Arist. VV 1250b29; fitted for bringing about, τοῦ μὴ πλανᾶν Phld. Rh. 1.347 S.

constructive, positive, opp. destructive ( λυτικός, ἀνασκευαστικός), Arist. Rh. 1403a25, Theon Prog. 12, etc.: c.gen., λόγος κ. ζητήματος Corn. Rh. p.377 H., cf. Nicol. Prog. p.29 F. Adv. -κῶς, opp. ἀνασκευαστικῶς, Arist. APr. 52a31.
κατασκευή VIII) systematic, γυμνάσια Gal. 6.177.

artificial, opp. αὐτοφυής, τὸ κ. D.H. Is. 11; ἡ κατασκευαστὴ δόξα, opp. ἡ σιωπωμένη ἀλήθεια, Id. 1.76; εἰκὼν κ. Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.210d. Adv. -τῶς under artificial conditions, Theon Intr. ad Euc. Opt. p.146 H.
suborned, ἄνδρες Arist. Oec. 1348a7.
she who prepares, Sch. Lyc. 578 (ed. Bachm.).
preparation, ὄντων ἐν κατασκευῇ τοῦ πολέμου being engaged in preparing for it, Th. 8.5; construction, λιμένων ἢ νεωρίων Pl. Grg. 455b; fitting out, πλοίων Plb. 1.21.1, etc.
unpacking, X. Cyr. 8.5.5.
training, Stoic. 3.89.

children.label: II
children.definition: permanent or fixed assets, opp. what is movable or temporary ( παρασκευή), fixtures, plant, etc., Th. 1.10; ἀνειληφότες τὰς κ. having repaired their estates, Id. 2.16; ἡ περὶ τὸν κλῆρον κ. Pl. Lg. 923d; τῆς ἄλλης κ., ἐν ᾗ κατοικοῦμεν καὶ μεθʼ ἧς πολιτευόμεθα καὶ διʼ ἢν ζῆν δυνάμεθα the aggregate of our possessions, Isoc. 4.26; αἱ κ. αἱ ἐπὶ τῶν ἀγρῶν ἢ αἱ ἐντὸς τείχους Id. 7.52; but also, like παρασκευή, any furniture or fittings, τὴν Μαρδονίου κ., i. e. his tent and its furniture, Hdt. 9.82; κ. πολυτελέσι χρησαμένων Th. 6.31; φιάλας τε . . καὶ θυμιατήρια καὶ ἄλλην κ. ib. 46; ἡ κ. τῆς οἰκίας D. 47.54; τῇ τῶν θεῶν κ. χρῆσθαι whatever the gods provided, X. Ages. 9.5.

data.quote: αἱ κ. αἱ ἐπὶ τῶν ἀγρῶν ἢ αἱ ἐντὸς τείχους

children.label: III
children.definition: state, condition, constitution of a thing, θεοῦ κ. βίῳ δόντος τοιαύτην E. Supp. 214; αἱ . . κ. τῆς ψυχῆς Pl. R. 544e; ἡ τοῦ βίου κ. Id. Lg. 842c; ἡ τῶν νόμων κ. ib. 739a; ἐν πάσῃ κ. πολιτικῇ ib. 736b; ἐν χρημάτων κ. in the constitution of a manʼs fortune, Id. Grg. 477b; ἐν σώματος κ. ibid.; κ. τις παρὰ φύσιν, definition of νόσος, Gal. 6.837.

children.label: IV
children.definition: device, trick, τέχναι καὶ κ. Aeschin. 2.1, v.l. in Din. 1.34; ἄνευ κατασκευῆς ᾄδειν artlessly, Ael. NA 5.38.

children.label: V
children.definition: constructive reasoning, opp. ἀνασκευή, D.H. Lys. 24, Hermog. Prog. 5, etc.: in pl., Cic. Att. 1.14.4, Longin. 11.2, Quint. 2.4.18.

children.label: VI
children.definition: artistic treatment, κ. ποιητική Str. 1.2.6, D.H. Comp. 1; manipulation, συλλαβῶν, γραμμάτων, ib. 15, 16; elaboration, Id. Pomp. 2, etc.; correct style, opp. ἰδιωτισμός, Diocl. Stoic. 3.214; technical resources, πλάσμα καὶ ἡ ἄλλη κ. δημηγόρου Phld. Rh. 1.199 S.

data.quote: πλάσμα καὶ ἡ ἄλλη κ. δημηγόρου

children.label: VII
children.definition: construction, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 2.4, cf. Procl. in Euc. p.203 F.; κ. ὀργανική solution by mechanical construction, Papp. 174.17.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: system of gymnastic exercise, as t.t., Gal. 6.169.
furnished, οἶκος dub.l. in IG 12(3).185 ( Astypalaea).
aor. κατεσσκέωσα IG 14.241 (Neëtum): pf. κατεσκεύωκα Test.Epict. 4.13:— Med., εἴ τι κα -σκευώσωνται GDI 1874.26 (Delph.).
careful examination, χωρίων Str. 6.1.12.
practise: pf. part. Pass. κατησκημένος regular, ascetic, δίαιτα Plu. Ages. 33.
= sq., aor. - εσκήνησα X. An. 3.4.32, HG 4.5.2, etc.: — Med., κατασκηνᾶσθαι Pl. R. 614e.

take up oneʼs quarters, encamp, εἰς . . X. Cyr. 4.5.39, Hell.Oxy. 16.2, etc.; ἐν . . LXX 1 Ch. 23.25; ἔνθα κατεσκηνώκατε X. Cyr. 6.2.2: generally, rest, ἐπʼ ἐλπίδι LXX Ps. 15(16).9; settle, of birds, ἐν κλάδοις Ev.Matt. 13.32: metaph., οὐ ψυχὴ ἐν μόνῳ ἀνθρώπῳ κ. Porph. Abst. 4.9.

data.quote: οὐ ψυχὴ ἐν μόνῳ ἀνθρώπῳ κ.

children.definition: covering, veil, A. Ch. 985.

encamping, taking up oneʼs quarters, LXX 1 Ch. 28.2, al.; καλεῖν τινα πρὸς κατασκήνωσιν Plb. 11.26.5; διδόναι εἰς κ. to give them as quarters, OGI 229.57 ( Smyrna, iii B.C.); ἐν κ. in camp, Onos. 11.6: pl. -σκηνώσεις βασιλέων Gp. 11.2.9.
resting-place, nest, Ev.Matt. 8.20 (pl.).

rush down or fall upon, Arist. Mu. 395a25, D.S. 16.80, etc.; of the rainbow, Arist. HA 553b30; of divine visitations, τοῖσι Λακεδαιμονίοισι μῆνις κατέσκηψε Ταλθυβίου Hdt. 7.134; ἐς ἀλλέλους ib. 137; ἤν κατασκήψῃ ἐς τὴν Πελοπόννησον, of an omen, Id. 8.65; ὀργαὶ κ. ἐς τὸ σὸν δέμας E. l.c.; τίς κατέσκηψεν τύχη; A. Supp. 327; ἐς Οἰδίπου παῖδε Ἄρης κ. Ar. Fr. 558; of Nemesis, D.H. 3.23; esp. of sickness, attack, [ ἡ νόσος] κατέσκηπτε ἐς ἄκρας χεῖρας καὶ πόδας Th. 2.49, cf. Hp. Epid. 3.8; εἰς γυναῖκας D.H. 9.40; ῥεῦμα κ. τινὶ ἐς τὰ νεῦρα Paus. 6.3.10, cf. Gal. 1.286; ἡ ξανθὴ [χολὴ] ὀδόντι Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.40, etc.

data.quote: ἡ νόσος] κατέσκηπτε ἐς ἄκρας χεῖρας καὶ πόδας
ῥεῦμα κ. τινὶ ἐς τὰ νεῦρα

children.definition: fall upon, τινα dub.l. in E. Med. 94 (fort. τινι):— Pass., κατασκηφθέντα χωρία struck by lightning, Hsch. s.v. ἐνηλύσια.

children.label: II
children.definition: εἰς ὅ τι -σκήψει τέλος ὁ δαίμων νέμεσιν Plu. Aem. 27.

data.quote: εἰς ὅ τι -σκήψει τέλος ὁ δαίμων νέμεσιν

children.label: III
children.definition: κ. λιταῖς storm or importune with prayers, c. inf., S. OC 1011.

children.label: IV
children.definition: break out, go forth, of a report, App. BC 3.25; κ. εἰς τέλος come to an issue, of a war, D.H. 3.54.
attack, τῶν παθῶν Dsc. Ther. Praef.

definition: κατασκιάζω, fut. - σκιάσω, Att. -σκιῶ S. OC 406:—

children.definition: overshadow, cover over, κατὰ δʼ ἐσκίασαν βελέεσσι Τιτῆνας Hes. Th. 716; ἡ δέ οἱ κόμη ὤμους κ. Archil. 29; σαρξὶν πάντα κατεσκίασεν ἄνωθεν Pl. Ti. 74d; spread awnings, E. Ion 1142; κόνει bury one, S. l.c.; θανόντα . . γαῖα κατεσκίασε IG 7.580 ( Tanagra).

data.quote: ἡ δέ οἱ κόμη ὤμους κ.

definition: κατασκιάω, poet. for foreg., Od. 12.436:— Pass., Opp. H. 3.467.
κατασκίδναμαι, Pass. of κατασκεδάννυμι, Plu. Max. cum princip. 2.776f.

children.definition: shaded or covered with, λάχνῃ δέρμα κ. Hes. Op. 513, cf. Hdt. 2.138, A. Ag. 493, S. El. 422; shaded, νῶτον Pi. Pae. 6.139: later c. gen., αἰγείροιο AP 9.333 ( Mnasalc., v.l. αἰγείροισι): metaph. in Astrol., ἀργὸς καὶ κ. τόπος, of a region, Vett.Val. 77.25; name of second τόπος, Id. 179.13; of third, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).144.

children.label: II
children.definition: overshadowing, λόφοι A. Th. 384, Ar. Ach. 965 codd., cf. E. Ph. 654 (lyr.).
become hard or dry through age, κατεσκιρωμένης ( -σκηρ- cod.) · πεπαλαιωμένης, Hsch., cf. eund. s.v. κατεσκληκότα (ubi- σκληρ- cod.).

children.label: II
children.definition: pf. inf. κατεσκιρῶσθαι (sic cod. Patm., - σκειρῶ- cod. Phot.), = λελευκάνθαι, Apollod.Hist. Fr. 107(c) J. (nisi leg. κατεσκυρῶσθαι eodem sensu).
leap upon, τοῦ βήματος Plu. An seni 2.790c.
leap about, Ael. NA 5.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: show contempt for, τινος ib. 2.6, Polyaen. 8.23.7, etc.
harden, Hsch. s.v. καταμαλάσσοντα (dub.).
Hsch. (fort. κατεσκιρωμένα).
very hard, Ph. Bel. 71.30, Hippiatr. 96.
become hard, Thphr. CP 4.12.9, Gal. 11.531.
reconnoitring, Eust. 69.37.

definition: κατασκοπεύω, = sq., LXX Ex. 2.4, al., PTeb. 230 (ii B.C.).

children.definition: view closely, spy out, reconnoitre, κ. ὅποι . . E. Hel. 1607; τὰ ἀγγελλόμενα reconnoitre, Aen. Tact. 23.10; εἴ πῃ . . X. Cyr. 7.1.39, cf. Th. 6.50, al.; τῶν πολεμίων Plu. Sol. 9; keep a look-out, of ships, Plb. 3.95.6:— Med., -σκοπεῖσθαι ἑαυτήν X. Mem. 2.1.22; αὐτὸς ἑαυτὸν κ. Arist. MM 1213a5; inspect, τὰς πανοπλίας Plb. 10.20.2; γραφήν POxy. 1414.4 (iii A.D.); of a medical examination, Gal. 1.293.

viewing closely, spying, πέμπειν τινὰ εἰς κατασκοπήν S. Ph. 45; μολεῖν εἰς κ. E. Ba. 838; ἐπὶ κατασκοπήν X. Cyr. 6.2.9, cf. HG 1.4.11, Arist. Ath. Fr. 4, Plb. 3.95.8; ἐπὶ -σκοπῇ τῶν πραγμάτων Aeschin. 2.28; κατασκοπῆς ἕνεκα X. An. 7.4.13; ἔχειν κ. Plu. Fab. 12; κατασκοπαῖς χρωμένους Th. 6.34; ἐς τὴν κ. τῶν χρημάτων to inspect the money, ib. 46.

definition: κατασκοπία, ἡ, fem. of κατάσκοπος, epith. of Aphrodite at Troezen, Paus. 2.32.3.

children.definition: for scouting: - κὰ, τά (sc. πλοῖα), Plu. Cat.Mi. 54.
look-out ship, Gell. 10.25 (sed leg. - σκοπικόν).

definition: κατασκοπίς (sc. ναῦς), ίδος, ἡ, = foreg., Gloss.

children.definition: one who reconnoitres, scout, spy, Hdt. 1.100, 112, al.; κατάσκοπον πολεμίων πέμπειν E. Rh. 125; πεμφθεὶς Ἰλίου κ. ib. 505, cf. Hec. 239, Th. 6.63; τριήρεις πέμψαι κ. Plu. Lys. 10; τῶν λόγων κ. Ar. Th. 588, cf. X. Cyr. 6.1.31; πραγμάτων Men. Pk. 105.
examiner, inspector, Th. 4.27, cf. 8.41; τῆς προσόδου ἐκ σίτου Fouilles de lʼInstitut Français dʼArch. Orientale du Caire 4(2). p.74: metaph., κ. βίου Secund. Sent. 7.

children.label: II
children.definition: κατάσκοπος, ον, closely covered, Sch. Opp. H. 3.636 (sed leg. - σκεπος).
scatter abroad, D.S. 24.1.
veil in darkness, Gal. UP 10.3.
look gloomy, J. AJ 11.5.6.

definition: κατασκυθρωπάω or κατασκυθρωπ-έω, = foreg., c. gen., Suid.

children.definition: make jokes upon, τινα Hdt. 2.173; mostly in bad sense, jeer, mock, Id. 3.37, 151.
disparage, depreciate, Arist. EN 1163a14, Phld. Vit. p.37 J.
speak disparagingly of, accuse as niggardly, τὴν φύσιν Hp. Ep. 17.
lessen, abridge, τὴν τοῦ λόγου σεμνότητα Demetr. Eloc. 44, cf. Luc. Gall. 14, Porph. Sent. 40:— Pass., to be made small, LXX 2 Ki. 7.19; become less, Marcellin. Puls. 310: metaph., M.Ant. 8.36.

children.label: II
children.definition: belittle, - σμικρῦναι καὶ διαφαυλίσαι Hierocl. p.59 A., cf. Max.Tyr. 22.2, Ath. 8.359a, Simp. in Epict. p.102 D.

children.label: III
children.definition: (Max.Tyr. 34.1 ( Pass.).
smelling of myrrh, Dsc. 1.27.

burn with a slow fire, burn up, κατά τε σμῦξαι πυρὶ νῆας Il. 9.653: metaph., ὅς με κατασμύχων, of love, Theoc. 3.17:—in Pass., of a disappointed rival, waste away, Id. 8.90, cf. Phalar. Ep. 144.4; σεσηρός τι καὶ κατεσμυγμένον ὑποβλέπειν Hld. 7.21.
rub in pieces, bruise, Nic. Th. 860, Al. 332.
regard haughtily, τινος J. BJ 3.1.1, D.L. 1.81, Men.Prot. p.321 D.
frighten away, scare, τοὺς ὄρνιθας Arist. Mir. 841b22; drive down, εἰς βαθὺ φρέαρ Parth. 14.3.

outwit by sophisms or fallacies, c. acc. pers., LXX Ex. 1.10, Luc. DDeor. 5[1].1, etc.; ταῖς εὑρησιλογίαις κ. τὴν δύναμιν τῆς πεπρωμένης D.S. 17.116; τὸν νόμον διὰ τῆς ἑαυτοῦ κακουργίας κ. Just. Nov. 72.5: c. gen., Ael. in Ar.Byz. Epit. 58.6:—also as Pass., to be outwitted, Plu. Profect. 2.80c, Alex.Aphr. in SE 43.22, Luc. DDeor. 18[16].2, Longin. 17.1.

data.quote: ταῖς εὑρησιλογίαις κ. τὴν δύναμιν τῆς πεπρωμένης
τὸν νόμον διὰ τῆς ἑαυτοῦ κακουργίας κ.

children.definition: κ. τι περί τινων evade by quibbling, CIG (add.) 4224d10 ( Anticragus).
falsify, J. AJ 8.15.5.
outwitting, trickery, Alex.Aphr. in SE 48.10, Eust. 1695.36, Sch.Hermog. in Rh. 4.215 W.
Suid.
embrace, kiss, τινα Plu. Cor. 9; σορόν Id. Ant. 85; treat lovingly, φιλήμασι, θρήνοις, Hld. 5.11, 7.7.
do homage to a king, J. AJ 7.10.5.
Alciphr. 3.50.
tear in pieces, Ar. Eq. 729; βυβλίον Plb. 23.14.8, D.S. 29.21; κατεσπαραγμένη τὴν ἐσθῆτα Luc. Asin. 22.
wrap in swaddling-clothes, βρέφη Ph. 2.495.
drawing down, Arist. Mete. 369b20; ἐντέρων dub. in Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.108.
vibrations of the reed-tongue of a pipe, Thphr. HP 4.11.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: part, fragment, τῆς στρατιᾶς J. BJ 5.12.1 (dub.l.), cf. Hsch. and Suid. s.v. κάταγμα.

definition: κατασπασμικός, ή, όν, of a drug,

children.definition: curing κατασπασμός, POxy. 1088.68 (i A.D.).
Plu. QConv. 2.650c; ὑποχονδρίων Sor. 2.36; pulling down, demolition of buildings, Nech. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.136 (pl.), PRyl. 125.6 (i A.D.).
plucking, gathering of fruit-crops, ib. 97.6 (ii A.D.), etc.
stroking or rubbing down, cj. for - πασμός in Cael.Aur. TP 1.166.

children.label: II
children.definition: depression of spirits, Plu. Profect. 2.78a (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: lowering of the voice, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.8.5.
fitted for drawing down, γάλακτος Dsc. 2.136, cf. Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.31.6 ( v.l. - παυστικός) ; κ. δύναμις Philum. Ven. 10.4.
live wantonly, wanton, LXX Pr. 29.21, Am. 6.4, Luc. Epigr. 50.

definition: κατασπάω, fut. - άσω [ᾰ]: pf. - έσπᾰκα Ar. Eq. 718:—

children.definition: draw, pull down, μολυβδὶς ὥστε δίκτυον κατέσπασεν S. Fr. 840; κατασπάσαι τινὰ τῶν τριχῶν drag one down by the hair, Ar. Lys. 725; τινὰ τοῦ σκέλους Antiph. 86.3; κ. τὰς πεντηκοντέρους haul them down to the sea, set them afloat, Hdt. 1.164, cf. 7.193; τὰ σημεῖα κατεσπάσθη (in token of defeat), Th. 1.63; κ. τινὰ ἀπὸ τοῦ ἵππου X. An. 1.9.6; κατεσπακὼς τὰς ὀφρῦς, of one frowning, Alciphr. 3.3:— Pass., to be drawn down, τὰ κατασπώμενα . . κἀνασπώμενα, of the limbs of puppets, X. Mem. 3.10.7; κατεσπασμέναι ὀφρύες, of one frowning, Arist. HA 491b17; κατασπᾶσθαι ἐς ὕπνον, ἐς δάκρυα, Luc. DMar. 2.2, Anach. 23.

children.label: b
children.definition: gather fruit from, τὸν ἐλαιωνοπαράδεισον, prob. in PSI 1.33.26 (iii A.D.).

Pass., to be displaced downwards, of a dislocated bone, Hp. Mochl. 4, 5; to be convulsed, suffer a spasm, Id. Epid. 3.17.βʹ (or perh. to be drawn, as in facial paralysis); fall into a trance, PMag.Lond. 121.549.

children.label: II
children.definition: draw down or forth, τὰ γυναικεῖα Hp. Epid. 6.8.32, cf. Arist. GA 750b35; γάλα Dsc. 3.58; draw off, τὸ τὴν νοῦσον παρέχον Hp. Loc.Hom. 30 ( Pass.); χυμοὺς κ. [τὸ λουτρόν] App.Anth. 3.158.

children.label: III
children.definition: quaff, swallow down, Ar. Eq. 718, Ra. 576, Antiph. 204.13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: pull down, οἶκον, ἄλση, LXX 2 Ch. 24.7, 34.7; τὰ ὑψηλά ib. 31.1, cf. PTeb. 5.134 ( ii B.C., Pass.); τὴν Σμύρναν Str. 14.1.37, cf. 16.2.30 ( Pass.); κ. τὰς τάξεις break the ranks, Plb. 1.40.13: metaph., Phld. D. 1.17.

children.label: V
children.definition: lower, τὴν φωνήν Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.9.5.

children.label: VI
children.definition: precipitate, Zos.Alch. p.195 B. ( Pass.).

definition: κατασπειράω, in pf. part. Pass., τοῦ ἀπὸ τῶν ἄστρων κατεσπειραμένου φωτός dub.l. in Epicur. Ep. 2p.45U.; fort. κατεσπαρμένου ( scattered, given out).

children.definition: sow, plant, εἰς μήτραν ζῷα Pl. Ti. 91d: metaph., ἀνίας μοι κατασπείρας S. Aj. 1005:— Pass., ὁ κατεσπαρμένος σπόρος PMagd. 7.8 (iii B.C.).
beget, τινα E. HF 469, Phint. ap. Stob. 4.23.61a; τὸν κατασπείραντα him that begat me, Diph. 93.

children.label: II
children.definition: spread as in sowing, τοῦ χάρακος κ. [πυροβόλα] scatter them over . . , Plu. Cam. 34; αὐτοῖς αὔραν τινὰ κ. ἡ χώρα νότιον Id. Dio 25:— Pass., to be spread abroad, dispersed, εἰ μὴ κατεσπαρμένοι ἦσαν οἱ τοιοῦτοι λόγοι ἐν τοῖς πᾶσιν Pl. Lg. 891b.

data.quote: αὐτοῖς αὔραν τινὰ κ. ἡ χώρα νότιον
εἰ μὴ κατεσπαρμένοι ἦσαν οἱ τοιοῦτοι λόγοι ἐν τοῖς πᾶσιν

children.label: III
children.definition: plant, ἀμπελῶνα LXX De. 22.9; γῆν PMagd. 28.3 (iii B.C.), Ph. 2.262: metaph., [ νόσοι] χωρία καὶ πελάγη κατασπείρασαι τῶν ἀβουλήτων Id. 2.567; πλούτῳ Ἑλλάδα κ. D.H. Dem. 29.

data.quote: νόσοι] χωρία καὶ πελάγη κατασπείρασαι τῶν ἀβουλήτων

children.label: IV
children.definition: besprinkle, ἤδη καὶ λευκαί με κατασπείρουσιν ἔθειραι AP 11.41 ( Phld.).

data.quote: ἤδη καὶ λευκαί με κατασπείρουσιν ἔθειραι

children.definition: besprinkling with holy water, Plu. Def.orac. 2.438a (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: self-devotion, of Spanish retainers, Id. Sert. 14; cf. κατασπένδω II.3.

pour as a drink-offering, c. acc. cogn., χοὰς ὑπὲρ μητρὸς τάφῳ E. l.c.; κ. κατὰ τῆς κεφαλῆς ἀρυβάλλῳ ἀμβροσίαν κατὰ σοῦ Ar. Eq. 1094: abs., pour drink-offerings, Hdt. 2.151; τοῖς θεοῖς Plb. 3.11.6:— Pass., - σπένδεται ( -τε lapis) ἀκρήτῳ SIG 57.26 (Milet., V B.C.).

data.quote: κ. κατὰ τῆς κεφαλῆς ἀρυβάλλῳ ἀμβροσίαν κατὰ σοῦ

children.label: II
children.definition: wet, λιβάσι κ. παρηΐδα Trag.Adesp. 548.
κ. τινὰ δακρύοις honour with offerings of tears, E. Or. 1239; simply, κ. τινά lament with tears, AP 7.260 ( Carph.).

offer up, devote, consecrate, τινα D.S. 5.31; κατασπένδειν ἑαυτους devote themselves, of Spanish retainers, Str. 3.4.18; cf. κατάσπεισις II:— Pass., ἄνθρωπος κατεσπεισμένος Id. 4.4.5; πρόβατα κ. Plu. Alex. 50; Μούσαισι . . κατεσπείσθη πᾶς ὁ τεὸς βίοτος AP 7.27 (Antip. Sid.), cf. Longus 2.6; of a priest, to be consecrated, ἐπὶ τὰ ἱερά prob. in OGI 331.20 ( Pergam., ii B. C.).

data.quote: Μούσαισι . . κατεσπείσθη πᾶς ὁ τεὸς βίοτος

children.definition: urge on, λῃστὰς δορί with a spear, Ar. Ach. 1188; ἐλάτῃσι νῆα Opp. H. 4.91; ὁ ἄνεμος ἰσχυρῶς -έσπερχε drove [them] on, D.C. 41.46; κατασπέρχον, of circumstances, urgent, pressing, Th. 4.126:— Pass., to be driven on, J. BJ 4.2.4.

definition: κατασπερχωτήν ἐπὶ τὴν οἰκίαν, ἢ ἐπὶ τὴν ἑστίαν κεκαυμένη, Hsch.

children.definition: urge, hasten on, πρᾶγμα Aeschin. 3.67, cf. LXX Ex. 5.13:— Pass., of words, to be urgent or rapid, κατεσπεῦσθαι τὴν φράσιν D.H. Comp. 20 (Upton for κατεσπάσθαι) κατεσπεῦσθαι ( v.l. - εσπάσθαι) τὴν λέξιν Gal. 16.548; τὰ κατεσπευσμένα Longin. 19.2; ἡ ἁρμονία οὐ κ. Id. 40.4.
agitate, dismay, τινα LXX Da. 4.16(19).

children.label: II
children.definition: make haste, hasten, ib. De. 33.2.
haste, Thd. Pr. 1.27.
spot, stain, Hsch.
Anon. ap. EM 495.42.

children.label: II
children.definition: σπιλάς C) swoop down upon, as a sudden storm, Ph. Fr. 28 H., Suid. s.v. κατεσπίλασεν.
blemished, βοῦς Porph. Abst. 4.7.
Hsch.
throw down in the dust, make to bite the dust, τὸν ἄνδρα τῷ πελέκει κατεσπόδησεν Ar. Th. 560; κατεσποδημένω A. Th. 809.
sowing, PTeb. 341.5 (ii A.D.), POxy. 2121.42 (iii A.D.), Sch. Pl. Lg. 853d, Phot. s.v. κερασβόλα.
sower, PFay. 118.11 (ii A.D.), PLond. 1821.217.
BGU 12.10 (ii A.D.).
